I would be willing to go back again if they lowered the price, although I do understand that the money I paid goes to help care for the cats there.
author: Connie X.

description:
Cats. And green tea. And cats.

You had me at cats. 

I've been to one cat cafe before this, in Bangkok, so I was au fait with the concept. Having moved here back in August, leaving behind my own adorable cat with my mum, I didn't need much of an excuse to go pet all teh kittehs. The rules are simple: mind the door, because escapees. Don't be a twat to the cats. (Some are up for attention, but don't force it obvs.) And you can buy treats to cajole them, which, of course, I did. 

The tea is amazing and you get free refills with your entrance fee. You can also hang out and just grab a cuppa at the cafe, if you're not super bothered about being in with the cats. (But, why would you not want to go in?!) Towards the end of the day they're more playful and you might get to see them get fed, which is adorable. Ron was a firm favourite -- he's one of the bigger ginger lads. If you're more interested in a hug, I'd suggest earlier in the day when they're feeling more sleepy and cosy. 

And the shop has all the cute af cat accessories etc. that you could possibly want.
author: Rowena H.

description:
REVIEWER # 115

I LOVE the idea....However, I don't like cats. (Sorry cat lovers)

Such a unique name and place, I must say that when I had seen this for my first time walking down Page Street it definitely caught my eye. Not because the cats were looking at me through the window but because the name is so unique and the vision of the business is such a great idea!

For those who have never heard of this place before KitTea is San Francisco's first Japanese Style cat café that has arrived in Hayes Valley. It opened around June and has been the talk of the town since! Why? Because of the amazing concept that I have been bragging about!

The Cat Café offers pet lovers the opportunity to be up and personal with cats that are in need of the home while you not only enjoy good company but also great tea! How cool, right?

KitTea partners with San Francisco Based Rescue, Give me Shelter which rescues cats from shelters all across the U.S. The café is not big but can host up to 15 cats at a time. 

The first time I visited this café was with my friends. We spoke to a lovely lady who explained the concept of KitTea and they spoke to us about the tea.

DID YOU KNOW: The hand thrown teapots are from Berkeley based ceramicist?! Yess! And the café offers a variety of Chinese tea as well as a handful of herbal blends! They offer pastries as well from Dynamo Donuts, San Francisco Cheesecake and Native Baking. 

I do suggest you make reservations as drop-ins seem to be a hit or miss and for one hour its $25 which includes unlimited refills of Tea. I hear that reservations can be made online so check out their website for more information!

It's definitely a great place for cat lovers but for myself I do better looking at them from outside the shop!

REVIEW 102/196
author: Porsche C.

description: For cat and tea lovers, this is the perfect spot to spend an outdoors or two. Enjoy some tea, scones and other little bites and gaze or play with cats. You can  sit in the tea lounge and view the cat play lounge or pay the $20-$25 per hour fee and play with the cats in the cat lounge. The cats are super friendly and like to play with you! Didn't get a chance to play with the cats due to reservation times and limited time in the area, but it was super chill while enjoying some tea and cat-seeing. Great atmosphere and lots of things to buy in the cat store.
author: Stanley C.

description: Such a fun place! How could you say no to fuzzy time with a bunch of cute cats!! Took my boyfriend for the first time and he couldn't believe how fast the hour went by. We were on vacation in the area and were missing our cat at home and this was a fun distraction. Thank you so much KitTea Cafe!
author: Shelby C.

description:
This must be what paradise looks like: adorable cats and unlimited green tea.

I had an absolutely wonderful experience at KitTea. The staff was nice and knowledgeable, the café is super well organized, and the cats are so adorable. Most of the cats were asleep, but they didn't mind being cuddled while sleeping, so I felt like I got a lot of quality cat time. The hour completely flew by and I considered buying the extension hour for $15. I will definitely come back!

The only downside is that they let up to 12 people in at a time. We were only 5, and that felt like a comfortable number. With only around 10 cats out and a small space I can imagine that the experience with 12 people is a lot different and less satisfactory.
author: Michala R.

description: This place is really over rated. Yeah its a cool place to hang out with cats and meet new people but its not worth the expense of $80 an hour for two people. I think the pricing strategy for what you get is totally not equivalent to what you receive. Bottomless basic teas and an hour with cats. The people were nice and my gf enjoyed the place but i don't really think its worth it personally. If you're into hanging out with cats that do cat things like nap and lay there then this is most definitely the place for you.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
I booked an 11 AM cat lounge visit reservation on Sunday for a friend and I. The cost was $25 per person with unlimited green tea. I arrived around 30 minutes early because I thought I would have to search for street parking but easily found a free parking spot in front of Minas Brazilian Restaurant and arrived 20 minutes early. 

The cafe area is separate from the cat area which I thought was sanitary. I had a cup of green tea while I waited. There was a choice of 4 different types. My favorite of the two that I tried was the Sencha. This was my first cat cafe visit and I wanted the cats to like me so I YouTubed some Jackson Galaxy videos the night before in preparation. I took care of my neighbor's cats while they went on vacation when I was younger and have always loved cats. I found out that I've been petting cats wrong my whole life! Apparently, the best place to pet cats is by rubbing their cheeks/chin and petting the back of their neck/on top of their head. The cats were so adorable! I wanted to take a few of them home but I can't because my apartment doesn't allow pets. Who knew petting cats could be so therapeutic?
author: Karen L.

description:
Unique, memorable and a relaxing experience. You must go here! 

This place rescues cats at risk for euthanasia and gives them a new lease on life. You can reserve one hours worth of time in the cat lounge where cats roam freely. You can play, pet, or simply watch their antics while sipping on delicious tea and food. The reservation comes with bottomless tea, food is extra.  Beware of hungry cats, they WILL try to steal away your food if you aren't paying attention. 

I recommend coming 45 minutes before your reservation, and eating at the cafe. This maximizes your one hour time limit in the cat lounge. When I went there, they were out of bubble waffles, but their regular waffles are exceptional. The tea is no joke, extremely high quality, and brewed at just right temperature to ensure a smooth flavor. As a tea fanatic and connoseur, I was pleasantly surprised. The Sencha had no bitterness to it, and the kikucha had just the right balance of leafy astringency to bitterness. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Chris R.

description:
Uhhhhhhhhhhhhh. Being the only cat cafe in the Bay Area definitely gives you an edge.... but $20 to drink tea with some cats? 

I is definitely a cute idea. And I love their work with cats and adoption and all that. I just think the price is a little steep. 

I think a cat lover would LOVE this place. Very cute vibe. In my case, I love dogs a whole lot more. 

Can someone open up a pug cafe or something? I'd pay 20 bucks for that haha.
author: Kiana V.

description:
I'm a big fan of themed cafes and had been to a cat cafe outside the US, so I was really excited to check out Kittea in SF! 

The set up was super interesting. There's a small front store, cafe, and the play room with a "Cat Wrangler" present. You can check out the cafe side for tea, coffee, waffles, etc. separate from the play room but still watch all the cats through the glass partition. 

The hourly rate on a weeknight was $20/per person; we made a reservation in advance online. With it, you get unlimited green tea (4 options to sample from; all were great) and an hour of playtime with the cats. 

The interaction with the cats was a wee underwhelming but still enjoyable; they are really well behaved and let you pet them but did not want to play with anyone hah. I was also surprised to learn that there were no kittens for adoption--which I thought was a great reason to pay for the experience (help cats get adopted). 

However, the cats we played with were rescued and now are the resident cats at Kittea and seem well cared for. Overall, I still had fun, but I might come back only to take super cat lover friends who would be ecstatic to be in a roomful of fluffy cats!
author: Ailien V.

description: The cafe was super cute! However, if you want to play with the cats, go at noon when they first open. The cats are sleeping anytime after that and are not much fun to be around. The cafe had very cute food.
author: Lorna Celynne Nicole R.

description:
Let me start off by saying, This was a birthday wish for my Cat Loving daughter- We are all Cat lovers and this was super exciting to try.
Not exactly what we had in mind, as you enter, its very stuffy and hot the cats, while very cute indeed, are really not interested in being petted or loved. My daughter was spoken to harshly for picking up one of the cats- Mind you we have cats at home- the staff told her she was going to hurt the cats insides? ( My daughter is 34) we know how to hold cats. Later, other people were picking up the cats and were not spoken too at all.
people were eating salads inside the room and the cats were jumping on the table trying to eat their food- while this was a novel idea, and if done differently, would have been a fun experience, for the amount of money we paid, this was a HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT.
author: D M.

description:
My 3000th review focuses on a place that has three of my favorite things: cats, tea, and word play. Kit Tea is one part tea house, one part cat adoption center, and one part gift shop, and all parts are awesome.

For the best experience, make an appointment ahead of time, ideally in the morning when the cats are more active. A weekday 11am was a good time for me and a friend to go, and we were part of a group of about eight, which is a good number for the play room.

Check in for your appointment, then grab a pot of tea while you wait- one is included with your visit. You'll get a solid hour of cat play time, complete with various toys. There were about 12 cats on site when we went, and most interacted with us in some way- coming close for a snuggle, sitting on laps, chasing laser pointers, fetching mouse toys, and even trying to hide in our purse and coat!

If you bond with a cat, you look into taking them home with you- all of the featured kitties are available for adoption, sourced from local organizations and selected based on how well socialized they are. The funds collected here go directly to support them. Location is exceptionally clean, cats very social, and staff we interacted with were very friendly and polite. I hope my city gets a cat cafe, it's a fun experience and a great cause.
author: Stefany V.

description: First time coming here and it was wonderful experience! Parking is pretty difficult here. We reserved the time at 3pm and we were kind of late due to parking. Before we went in we had to take off our shoes and put on hand sanitizer. The host was nice and gave us a brief introduction on what we should and shouldn't do. We came on a Thursday which is $15 per person. The room was pretty small but filled with cats. Most of them were sleeping though which is regular because cat sleeps 18hr a day lol! You get unlimited green tea when you're there and you can also order food. The room itself was pretty small though not very big. Overall this was a great cat cafe and you should check it out whenever you get the chance!
author: Tina C.

description: I love this place so much. Although some cats are unapproachable, these cats are so cute and adorable. The environment was great and the complimentary tea was nice too. It was a fun and relax way to destress yourself.
author: Carmen P.

description: We came for a work happy hour with a few gals from my office. This place has an adorable set up. If you love cats and puns their gift shop has the cutest items for any cat lover. The space is split between a cafe and the cat lounge. The cat lounge is bright and airy and does not smell like there are 14 kitties living there. The cats all have their own personalities. Dolly can't be bothered with and Blinx is the one eyed sweetie. It's a great place to come with friends or significant other. There are places to sit and relax and then you can pet the kitties as they come by.
author: Betty C.

description:
I feel like Shoshanna in an episode of Girls when she's living in Tokyo. 

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Omg omg omg. I've seriously died and gone to heaven. 

I LOVE KEETONS!!! The shear existence of a place like KitTea makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside. Exceptional kitty AND people watching. YAASSSSSS! 

The space is clean. Humidifiers throughout. Kitties are well taken care of and seem happy. 

I would recommend a reservation to enter the kitty play room. But you don't need a reservation to hang in the tea room. The kitties aren't overwhelmed. It's ideal. And they help rescue kitties! Couldn't be better!

The chocolate caramel bar was delish! But my chai was pretty terrible. But who cares there's kitties!!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Seeing all the pictures on yelp and IG, my boyfriend and I had high expectations going into this cafe. Unfortunately, we were underwhelmed with the experience and came out disappointed. 

This cafe charges $25 an hour per person on the weekends. The $25 comes with unlimited green tea, but no specialty drinks or food. We didn't try any of the food, but the unlimited green tea was high quality and really good. 

Our main problem was with the quality and quantity of the cats. In all the promotional pictures they post, it looks like there are at least 10+ cats that are all social and energetic. During my visit, however, there were really only 3 cats awake and most of them didn't want to be touched or played with. They were all completely bored of the toys, and we weren't allowed to give them treats either, so there was no way to excite or stimulate them. Also, it gets really awkward when there are 10 people in the tiny room crowding around so few cats, and there are more people staring at you through a glass wall.

I'm not angry with the cats, but I am confused by why the ownership/management would choose cats that aren't social to be in a cat cafe. And if the cats were social to begin with and then grew tired of human interaction, then the management should take that into consideration and have more or alternating cats. They even had a cat that was 15 yrs old and super frail, which no one was allowed to wake or pick up. Why have her in there at all if she's so weak? 

Overall, this place is not worth the visit. Maybe I could argue their case if everyday was priced like Thursdays, when it's $15/hr, but save your money and go pet some cats at your local shelter instead. They'd appreciate it more.
author: Winna P.

description:
We didn't get the chance, but I think it's quite pricey when we called the restaurant!
$25 per person (weekend), $20 for weekdays it comes with free unlimited tea. So definitely go if you like cat and tea!
author: Min T.

description: We had a lovely time at the cafe. All of the cats are adorable, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the space is meowvelous! There is a cute little shop at the front with lots of unique items for sale. The only downside is that the front area gets very crowded when groups of people are going into or out of the cat area, and there is not much seating room to take shoes on/off. Overall highly recommended!
author: Taylor D.

description:
To anyone complaining that the cats aren't social or just sleeping all the time, um, they are cats!! cats do what they want :) 

Will definitely come back again, hopefully during feeding time!
author: Greg G.

description:
I love this cat cafe! You're able to easily reserve an appointment through their website. They're hourly sessions and during it you get unlimited green tea to try. Yes it's pricey, but think about helping the great cause that KitTea is trying to do. 

There are a variety of cats, and from my experience, all the cats were so friendly. I look forward to coming back soon!
author: Kristen L.

description:
if you are cat lovers, but can not provide a home for them for kids allergy or other reasons. Here is your heaven. Friendly staff, 11 cats to play with, good food, lovely authentic Japanese tea.

But be aware of the parking situation, clean EVERYTHING out of your car before you leave your car. On-street parking only, homeless roaming around...  Heard people had their car broken into bc they left a jacket on the passenger seat. That is the sad truth for a lot of the SF neighborhoods, unfortunately, due to the homeless issues...
author: Anita Z.

description:
My hubby and I visited the kitties here on Labor Day (2017) - which also just happens to be our ninth anniversary! I booked it for today because (1) We needed a fun thing to do today (2) They were donating to help cats/dogs affected by the hurricane in Texas. (3) I LOVE cats. 

      Just as the website shows, KitTea Cat Café is very cute, clean, and fun. The staff were all very welcoming and our "cat wrangler" worked hard to make sure we enjoyed our hour with the cats in the lounge, while keeping the cats safe and happy. She told us the rules without being too strict, and even brought out a bowl of treats for us to let the cats eat out of our hands! That was interesting, some got a bit "nippy" but she warned us about that. I was happy that all of the cats were up and ready to play and/or hang out for some petting. We were there at 12:00 at opening time. 

           We enjoyed the complimentary green tea, and ordered free refills twice -ha. We skipped the food, as we planned to go out for a special lunch for our anniversary. I just HAD to buy something in their super cute shop before leaving - so I chose lavender cat drink coasters and a few stickers. I love all things kitty. Meow meow. 

          I would give it five stars, but I got injured when a fast moving cat ran by me and scratched my arms, and it bled, so our "wrangler" got out a first aid kit and gave me some ointment and a band aid. I asked for another one a bit later. I do not hold them accountable for this, as I am well aware of the risks associated with being around cats, and I in fact, used to be a volunteer cat cuddler for a few years, including another Bay area cat café, so I know the drill. The cat wasn't trying to hurt me, he was just running away from another cat to get up high on the shelf. I speak CAT. I would be happy to go back another time, perhaps for MEWVIE Night. I love the sense of kitty humor at this place! So cute. 

           So glad we came here today. It made our Anniversary day a bit furrier and adorable. I also appreciated the cat therapy, so to speak. Thank you to the KitTea team for being so friendly and helpful, and the owner for donating to Austin Pets Alive today. They are giving them 50% of the holiday's proceeds. For that, they deserve five stars, actually.
author: Debbie T.

description: Customer service here is top tier. The wife and I had a great experience. Time goes by faster than you think it would. Love all the kitties here!
author: Nikki C.

description:
Lovely café where you feel the love from the moment you walk through the door.
This place doesn't only offer great food and beverages, it has kitties for adoption, giving the fur babies a chance to interact with people in a relaxed setting.
Loved this place, took my best friend and husband with me and we all had an amazing time.
Keep up the amazing work you do Kittea!!
author: Constanza D.

description:
I love this place! I went to their Mewvie Night and watched Hocus Pocus. For reference, there were about 10 people in the room for Mewvie night so if you see a movie you want to see in the future, be sure to grab your tickets quickly because they do sell out!

The cats were so cute and friendly! I 100% recommend this experience to others! For the movie we were with the "permanent resident" cats but we could still see the cats that were adoptable in the other room through the window.

((TIP: if you are with the permanent resident cats be sure to look for Steve the big fluffy black cat. Haha he is super chill and "king of the castle"))

Also if you order refreshments! Just be sure to be very diligent in watching over your food and drinks if you order any! The cats love human food but shouldn't eat it! If you order popcorn they will flock to you hahah and they're quite persistent
author: Elaina R.

description: Visited the kitties for the last session of the afternoon (3pm). By that time of day, the cats were more into napping than socializing, which gave me more time to enjoy my genmaicha. 3:30pm is the daily feeding time and I happened to catch this piranha show during my first visit. I ordered a waffle wrap to snack on - looked and tasted like "eggettes" with a variety of sweet and savory accompaniments. Overall very relaxed vibe, highly recommend if you want a little peace and quiet of mind.
author: Anna Z.

description:
I remember reading an article that Japan had some cat cafes with just the customers interacting with the cats and drinking coffee / tea. So I've always been so curious about it. Now it's about time that I checked it out. In San Francisco. LOL. Yay. There's one at CA. Woot woot! So if you're thinking of making reservations for an hour time slot to play with the kitties in the room, you have to come in person to make a reservation and pay for it. It's about $25 to reserve a spot. It's based on first-come first serve basis. You can't make phone calls to make it. You have to step into there in person. Normally, when you step into the entrance, you will see some cute cat merchandise with the check-in desk along the cashier person. If you want to spend time with the kitties, you need to request for an appointment. They would tell you the availibility for a certain time slot that you can pick from. So you have the option to wait and enjoy your time at the awesome japanese cafe, drinking lovely tea or other type of drinks; or you can go out somewhere while you're waiting for your appointment time. They normally ask you for your phone number if anything comes up regarding your appointment time. 

Anyway, I made the option to try out the tea at the japanese cafe. It's abit petite, but cute. They have a restroom, that says "whichever." Quite creative with the words haha. There was an area where there's a clear glass window for customers to look at the kitties from the cafe. Quite entertaining to watch, yes. They also have wifi and the password is generally on a piece of handwritten paper, on the front of the desk that the cashier takes orders. I was craving for matcha, so I decided to try some. It was rather interesting to watch the waitress make the matcha tea the proper japanese way. It tasted so good. They served it in a big mug. I can bring in my tea into the kitty room, but I rather drink it before that because you'll never know what the kitties are gonna do lol. 

Then it was time to enter the kitty room! There were about 5-8 people for a slot in just one kitty room, I think. Idk. So we were greeted by the "kitty sensei master" who was telling us proper guidelines when interacting with the kitties and the do-not's. So when the kitties are resting, leave them be :) They need to recharge! Of course, sanitize your hands before playing with the kitties. You wanna keep the kitties safe from the outside germs on your hands xD There were few black cats and orange cats. They were so cute! There was black / white fur one with one eye, so be warned that that one may be alittle rough and aggressive.. haha. But I felt like most of the time, they cared only about the food. Pretty much.. So if you have some cat food that you purchased earlier at the entrance check-in desk, they will most likely go to you. Sometimes, the kitty sensei will give me some cat food to give to the cats, so I thought it was nice of him to do that. So I can get the feel what's it like to experience the cat fun. The kitty room consisted of kitty play materials. There's also a one person restroom, which you shouldn't allow cats inside lol. The toilet looked Japanese style. It was fun playing with the cats and other people. But I just kinda wished the cats were actually genuinely caring and not all about the food. Hmmm.. it's okay. At least I had fun for my first time here :)
author: Lynh N.

description: Great atmosphere for the cats!! Staff was great and so was the tea. Would definitely recommend to friends and family who want to adopt or just for the experience to relax and relieve some tension. Thank you!!
author: Cristina G.

description:
Clean facilities, friendly staff, and great cats. The cats are clearly well cared for and living their best cat lives. 

I didn't order much from the menu, so I don't have much to contribute there, but the genmaicha I had was very tasty.

My companion has fairly bad indoor allergies but the place was so clean that they didn't act up at all.

Can't wait to visit again!
author: Sara H.

description:
If you love cats or you're addicted to Neko Atsume, then you need to be here!

I never heard of this place until a few months ago, but I'm glad I came here! I've only been to a cat cafe in South Korea, but this place was just as amazing if not better. Reservations must be planned ahead of time to keep group sizes to a minimum. There are different activities you can do with the kitties like Cat Lounge, Cats on Mats, Happy Hour, and Mewvie Night. I did the Cat Lounge, and this activity allows you to spend 1 hour in a room of cats. The cats come from a local cat adoption agency called Wonder Cat Rescue, and are definitely up for the adoption here. Service here was super friendly and knowledgeable. Also the decorations of the place was on point. Hand sanitizer is provided for your cleanly needs. Also incase you've haven't tried one before, the toilet in the bathroom is one of those Japanese butt spraying toilets or an "Electronic Bidet."

All the teas were flavorful and very well brewed. 
Drinks I tried were the green teas: Sencha, Genmaicha, and Hojicha.
1) Sencha - It tasted like ordinary green tea. Not bad but not super amazing.
2) Genmaicha - My favorite of the three! I couldn't get enough of this.
3) Hojicha - The taste of this slightly reminded me of steamed vegetables.

So many cats, so little time. The cats love to roam around and play with toys. It's a good thing that we visitors don't have the opportunity to feed them because then they would be conditioned to only come close if we have food.

I'll be back again someday!
author: Kevin S.

description:
This is definitely a growing trend. These are all over the place now so I went to check it out! Now I LOVE cats but I don't want to pay $20 to pet cats for an hour. I thought this place just had cats roaming around but you actually have to pay extra to pet the cats. 

I opted out to just drink a cup of tea which was AMAZING by the way and watch them through a window. 

They have a happy hour on Thursdays where its $15. I might give them another chance and pay the money. I just cant pull myself together to do it.

Getting there is easy on public transit as VanNess Station is a few blocks away. Convenient location!
author: Daniel S.

description:
What isn't there to love about a kitty cafe? An event with Hannah Shaw, aka, Kitten lady brought me here and it did not disappoint. Good coffee, friendly staff, and super cute cats and kittens. 

Looking forward to visiting again.
author: Lolly F.

description:
Amazing!! I booked an appointment online, which was super easy, and their bookings are relatively open. Me and my sister arrived a few minutes late, but they still let us into the cat room, which was very nice of them. The package comes with bottomless green tea and you can also order food a la carte, but there's no time to eat when you have so many cats to look at, honestly.

They play relaxing oldies music quietly as you play with the cats. The cats are actually pretty friendly!! Other cat cafes that I've been to, the cats are sick of humans. Around 4-5pm (during my second booking), the cats are pretty sleepy. From 6-7pm (my first booking), they get fed dinner and get pretty excited. It's really fun to watch.
author: Lulu T.

description: The person that checked us in was awesome. And the "Cat Wrangler" was so nice! They really made my sister's birthday.
author: Christopher K.

description: Well run, clean, and full of cats!  The food and drink is also great!
author: Naomi M.

description:
Even I was late to the Cat yoga event, they let me in. The staff is nice and friendly, cats are so adorable that it feels like they are "the cat staff" of the space. Very cozy and chill. I highly recommend to all cat lovers to visit KitTea.
Also I can`t wait to return to check out the movies event and teas.
author: Olga T.

description: I thought this was going to be so much better than it was. I got yelled at for picking up a cat, while everyone else was picking them up and feeding them human food from their lunches. Overpriced
author: Casey F.

description: We booked our visit a week in advance for a Friday at 5pm, the cat wrangler and all the staff were very friendly and the tea and treats were tasty.  We had a waffle with fruit and Nutella and a plain one too in our party.  The ginger scone was excellent!  My son tried the hot chocolate with homemade marshmallows which he really liked.  Cats were entertaining and cute.  Definitely worth doing once, it is pricey but it is unique.
author: Stuart C.

description: Super Great Experience. It was my first time and interesting at that. Quite smaller than expected. The cats are super sweet. Just try to get the earliest reservation with the cats as there are times they want to rest!
author: Derek D.

description: Awesome place!! Great food and tea (Nutella waffle with fruit was yummy) and lots of sweet, cool and quirky cars to let and play with. My favorite was Dolly. Such a sweetheart. This was a highlight of my San Francisco trip!
author: Courtney K.

description: Amazing! The cats are adorable and had such cute personalities! Oh and the humans were sweet too ! If you're a cat lovers, go and visit! $ well spent and for a good cause. One of the highlights of our trip.
author: Mary S.

description: Super fun and relaxing! There was a good mix of playful and cuddly cats. (Also I highly recommend the iced chai).
author: Reilly M.

description: I took my sister for some relaxation and fun. The host was very nice. The place is small but they make sure to care a lot for the cats. We loved the experience of drinking tea and petting the cats. The only sad thing was that the cats were sleepy and wouldn't wake up until we only had 20 minutes left. We enjoyed it a lot so we will sure be back soon.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
We went on a Wednesday at 2pm. Parking is really difficult in this part of town. The nearest lots we found were already full. Luckily we found street parking, but it was a stressful hassle. When you arrive you first go into a small cafe area away from the cats, it was really crowded and standing room only. This is where we waited for our turn in the room. When it was our turn I had to remind the receptionist that we purchased socks online before arriving. I feel like they should know that ahead of time instead of waiting for me to ask and looking confused when I ask? AND online they lead you to believe that you need to be wearing socks. But I saw people in there that were barefoot, kinda gross. However, the staff was friendly and the cat wrangler guy was really cool. The cats were all asleep when we got there, which is understandable because that is what cats do. The cats that were there were mostly adult cats who wanted to be left alone. Don't expect a bunch of hyper and playful kittens. I am okay with that personally, but don't be shocked if you visit and only get to pet a few sleeping cats. The cat room was very clean and the cats looked healthy and well cared for. I wish there wasn't so many people in there at the same time with the cats. There were about 10 people and only 7 cats around- only 2 cats were awake and walking around. Majority of the cats are resident cats- with two being up for adoption at any given time. I appreciate that they are helping homeless cats get adopted!

Overall- great idea, but overpriced for what it is. If you go, consider that your money may be going to a cat being adopted. That made it worth it to me. 

Oh, and the tea was good.
author: Samantha M.

description:
Great place to if you loooove cats.

Originally when I heard of a cat café I envisioned a regular coffehouse with big chairs and cats lounging all around.  KitTea is a very structured system.  The price of admission ($20 on weekdays, $25 on weekends plus a $1 booking fee if you book online which does not apply if you book over phone or walk in) gets you a 1 hour time slot in the cat lounge with unlimited green tea.  They have an impressive selection probably because they are influenced by the Japanese style cat cafes including Kukicha, Hojichasun, Sencha, and Genmaicha green teas.  They even have ceremonial matcha tea which is extra.   They serve food and other drinks as well.  1 hour for the price seems like a lot but it can get tiring after a while playing with cats non- stop so I think it's worth it.

There is a 'cat wrangler' in the lounge who make sure everything is in order as well as taking food and drink orders however they cannot technically serve the food since it's goes against health codes because they are working with animals so you pick it up outside the cat lounge.  
There are cushions for the cats, shelfs for them to jump on, books about cats, and some toys for guests to engage and play with the cats.  Outside the cat lounge is a little café where you can go without paying the entrance fee if you just wanted to observe some furry felines.  

One of the things I randomly loved the best was the warm Japanese style Japanese toilet seats!   I haven't seen one since I was in Japan years ago and that was one of the best things I remembered about being in Japan.

For me this is 5 stars because I love cats so much!  And ceremonial matcha tea.  And warm toilet seats.  For others I think it might be just okay if you aren't that into cats.
author: Joan W.

description: Cute place and concept. But the girl that was working the cat room was wound up tight. She was very rude and unfriendly making the whole experience less enjoyable. Was impatient if you didn't know all the rules and before even entering the room she was like a mean school teacher. Then she stayed in the room and I felt like she was watching our every move. Bummer vibe. Too bad.
author: Tiffany M.

description: AMAZING. Relaxing and all the cats are very friendly! The hostess was very helpful and sweet. The cafe was pricey but delicious ! The portions were a good size. The tea was absolutely delicious! We had Earl Grey Cream, I highly recommend it!
author: Dominique Z.

description: The staff here is very friendly and the cat handler/trainer is very good with all the cats! They give you bottomless green tea with your visit and I do suggest you make an appointment before stopping in! Cats and tea ... This is a million dollar idea
author: Deanelle M.

description: If you are a cat lover, this is the place for you. They have 2 rooms. One where there are all the cats, the other where there are tables and u can have your tea  and snacks and watch the cats in the next room through the glass. They serve Japanese tea which is good. I ended up not eating as I was busy with the cats! You can spend an hour with the cats. They are the cutest little things. You can pet them and play with them. Some are up for adoption too. Although most of them maybe sleeping when you get in.. but the smart little creatures will wake when it's feeding time. You get to feed them as well. They are so disciplined when they eat! Overall it was an amazing experience. We will be looking to come here once again.
author: Niti K.

description: My husband bought the 1 hour cat Cafe experience as part of an early Christmas present. I've been wanting to visit this establishment since it opened so I had high expectations. Sure enough, I was very thrilled with the charming atmosphere of the cafe, the friendly staff, lots of adorable cat merchandise, and of course the cats! The food and teas were enjoyable as well. We had the Dolly Purrton and Paw Lickin Chickin. They were delicious. Even the cats kept wanting some so we did our best to distract them from the food! It was a unique experience playing and getting to know their personalities. The cat wrangle, Josh is very knowledgeable and made getting to know the cats a fun experience. I would definitely recommend cat lovers to visit! -Wife
author: JR M.

description: The cats were so friendly and cuddly and the women working were the nicest and knew a lot about what they were doing. The menu looked phenomenal, but I only had the bottomless green tea, which was just as good! I even spent waaayyy too much on their adorable cat stickers and t-shirts but I'm glad to support a business like theirs!
author: Quinn N.

description: What a wonderful place to go to help cats and to get a cat fix while on vacation! The tea was yummy and the people there were as nice as the very friendly cats.
author: Meg P.

description: It was such a great experience for such a great cause. We had an hour with tea and kitties that went by so quickly. I would recommend to others and even try to go back myself
author: Samantha R.

description: I think they have done a wonderful job creating a fun, clean, interactive place for visitors to sit, perhaps enjoy some tea and a snack, and experience the cats. All of the kitties were friendly and some were very playful- I would definitely come back again!
author: James J.

description: Weird ass place! Definitely waaay over priced and definitely NOT ENOUGH cats... weird ambiance... felt like I was part of some experiment... uncomfortable seating... all the cats were kind of shaved funny in the back... they just sort of sleep all the time unless you feed them... I just felt really WEIRD the whole time... I actually pictured something TOTALLY different! Sad  Can't believe I spent $75 here...
author: Sunflower H.

description: Such a fun thing to do with kids! Really nice facility and yummy food. Staff was great too.
author: Anna S.

description: We loved it.  There were a lot of people visiting the cats, but the cats are super social and seemed very happy to get the attention.  The tea and gift shop were terrific too.
author: Belinda G.

description: The kitties were friendly and playful, and the humans were very nice and good at explaining what to do when and how it all worked. We had a great time.
author: Julia G.

description: I love cats and tea but this establishment is a joke. It makes san francisco look bad. The overall idea is great but the girls are incredibly rude. I've never met people with such bad customer service and absolutely no people skills. I feel bad for the people who travel just to come see the place. To say it's a let down is an understatement.
author: Ness H.

description:
Truly an amazing experience. It's what you imagine it will be. Tea and lots of cats. Prices are kinda high to go into the room with the cats (which is the whole point), but they have a one of a kind business. 

Also i think it was better when they used to have new cats in rotation, as opposed to mostly resident cats now. I think that helping cats get adopted was an important part of what makes this place special. I think the benefit outweighs the temporary adjustment period for new cats.

Nonetheless,  super pleasant place. 

Also they have some really excellent matcha tea.
author: Alexander W.

description: It's always fun with the kitties, and the tea & waffles are delicious.  If I didn't already have three cats, a couple of them would have been coming home with me!
author: Linda F.

description: I had a great time. I went to KitTea Cafe for my friends birthday. There were three of us and it was easy to set up a reservation day of. I loved how well kept the cats are. They are also avid on getting their cats adopted as well as making sure their guests are having a good time. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because I wish there were a few more cats. It did seem like the cats didn't mind people, but a few hid in the back and the rest were sleeping. Overall great experience. Workers were very sweet and the tea was great.
author: Katherine N.

description:
I really enjoyed visiting KitTea while visiting San Francisco. Loved playing with the kitties and getting to know them. Hour went by so fast. I was sad to say goodbye. I liked the tea but thought I would have had more. I got with the kitties and forgot the tea!
If I lived in SF, I would visit the cafe often for movie nights, events. Cute little shop out front.
author: Bruce A.

description:
Sooo much fun! I'm visiting the Bay Area and while planning a transit route, saw the cafe on Google maps! I was meeting up with a friend and decided to book my hour prior to enjoy some kitties. I really enjoyed the antics of the cats, there are some VERY individual characters there...I looooooved Steve! It's a very comfortable cafe compared to our Catfe in Vancouver BC. More akin to cafes I've visited in Tokyo. The staff are also really engaging so I have to give 5 stars! Lots of merch to gift any cat lovers you know, too. 
Next time....I'm having the smoked salmon waffle BEFORE I go in, I'll be the kitties favorite!
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Without any expectations going in, this exceeded any possible expectations for my sisters and I (cat lovers). Showing up a bit early was the perfect way to start, as we were able to enjoy some tasty complimentary tea and settle in. Our Lounge visit reservation was at 2pm and while we thought we walked into them all catnapping, it didn't take long to get a few playing, and from there it was all fun. The cats are all so adorable and adoptable, the place was clean and provided a diverse play session. Tea service was also included in your session. 

I'd come back for the unique experience and I would recommend this as a great way to find your perfect pet!
author: Ms. R.

description: The cats were wonderful and the staff was great. I didnt habe any tea because i was having so much fun with the kittys
author: Alyssa S.

description: I'm a cat person so I always wanted to come back at KitTea Cat Cafe
author: Malou A.

description:
You won't have an experience like this anywhere else. Get yourself some tea and a snack and head on in to chill with the cats.

Only downside is that the hour flys by so quickly!
author: Olivia D.

description:
I have found the happiest place on earth! It *is* in CA, but it's not Disneyland.... It's the KitTea Cafe! You drink tea and hang out with CATS! Adorable, playful, snuggly-sweet cats! And the best part is, it's an adoption facility as well - they average placing two cats per week into furr-ever homes! Two paws up!!

Tip: check their web site and social media feeds for discounts - and ALWAYS make a reservation! They are not usually able to accommodate walk-ins, as they need to make sure to limit the number of people in the cat lounge at once so they don't stress out the kitties. 

@kittea_SF on Instagram! 

We had so much fun here. Oh, and the tea was great too!
author: Angela Z.

description:
This is pretty expensive if you think about the fact that you're paying $25 to pay cats that don't necessarily want to be petted. There's also no time to drink tea if you want to make the most of your time inside with the cats. However, this is for a great cause, and I think that it's still something fun to do once. The kittens are adorable, and if you love fluffy creatures, this is the place to be. 

There are going to be a good number of people in the cat room with you, so you won't be petting cats the entire time you're there. Make sure you take someone whom you can make good conversation with.
author: Sophie W.

description: We've been wanting to visit here for a long time and we finally did it! Totally awesome experience. The cats were fun and playful. Staff was knowledgeable and kind. The tea and the menu were good (love the creativity of the menu items). But the star attraction are the cats! Just waaayyyy too cute! Nice that some of the cats were available for adoption and that rescue is very much the theme. Highly recommend reservations and getting there early so you can shop for all the cute kitty items, too!
author: D M.

description: This place is so much fun! My new obsession! I highly recommend Caturday morning Cartoons!
author: Aubri C.

description:
Fantastic place if you love cats and would like to be surrounded with them in all situations. Including while having a cup of tea. The staff is attentive and helpful. There are plenty of opportunities to interact with the kitties and get to know them. I expected them to be more skiddish and not want to be around new people but the second I sat down a beautiful black kitty came and sat in my lap. I was sold. 
Wish I lived in SF would spend most my down time at Kittea.
author: Irene P.

description: It was such a fun experience! I've been to a HANDFUL of cat cafes and this is one of my favorite. Clean facilities and lovely cats that are willing to interact with you rather than run away. Definitely will be coming back in the future!
author: Kim L.

description:
I'm a fan of cats and so was STOKED to find out that San Francisco had a cat cafe.  My coworkers are also fans of cats so we planned in advance to check it out together and celebrate our friend getting into graduate school.  One of our coworkers had two other friends who had wanted to check the place out so I said they were welcome to get a spot if they wanted to come at the same time we did.  One of these friends was even on the waiting list until an hour before our reservation.  We went and were excited to see some cats and maybe even some adoptable cats (two of my coworkers had been thinking about it).  Over all we had a great time with the cats, and the staff was courteous.  We did find out toward the end that none of the cats were up for adoption, which was disappointing and not clearly stated.  

At the very end, though, our party was singled out as we had broken the over 7 party policy because, as the front desk attendant stated "You obviously had 9."  She declared she would have to tell her manager.  Without any request for explanation or anything, I was left to stand awkwardly until I had a chance to ask if she wanted me to talk to the manager now...or if they would be in touch...to which she said, "No, my manager isn't here.  He'll email you."  It really ruined our enjoyment of the activity.

Well...five days later I received an email declaring we had broken the rule for 7 people without request for explanation declaring we had ruined the experience for two other visitors because we were a large group, even though one of my coworkers and her friend had chatted with these visitors and enjoyed petting cats together.  

I responded that I did not realize it was considered a party if some people in your group happened to know the other people who scheduled to come at the same day and hour.  I suppose I should have declared that her friends were not welcome to come at the same time or else we would all be charged the price of a whole party except I didn't realize that's how this rule would be interpreted.  

That day I had texted a picture of my time at the cafe to one of my bridesmaids who is coming into town for my bachelorette party.  She asked if we should go there with everybody, which would actually be a booked party, ironically right as I was being chastised.  So no, I will not be booking a bachelorette weekend at KitTea Cafe. I will not be bringing anyone else to KitTea Cafe because of how they handled this situation and I will not be returning myself or referring anyone else to come.  They don't have explicit policies on groups or adoption, they are ridiculously over priced, and they are incredibly rude.  I had a good time and then I didn't.  Nice job ruining the vibe.
author: Erin B.

description: Very friendly staff. Loved the experience. Great concept. Beautiful sweet cats.
author: Natalie D.

description:
This has been a long overdue review and I'm so thankful to have a place like this that I can actually go to (without jumping on a plane and flying to Japan). My boyfriend took me here as a treat for our 7 year anniversary. As a tea cafe, gift shop, cat adoption/kitty cuddle center, it's as good as it gets! I lost my furbaby Apollo last year and still haven't been able to get over it. This place definitely provided the fluff therapy I needed since I don't think I'm ready to have another cat yet (got a bunch of ferals that I feed outside my house though). 

It's $25 for a full hour to play with the kitties with a free cup of tea; best to make an appointment ahead of time just in case. All the kitties are adoptable so it's alright if you fall in love with one and want to take it home. Socks are a must to go into the room but you can always purchase an adorable pair of kitty socks if you didn't bring any. In the kitty room, it's kitty heaven, for me and the kitties. There are high and low places for them to hide/lounge. Toys and treats were everywhere for the kitties, a much better place for them than the shelter (and a better chance for them to get adopted being able to have interaction with people). A "Cat Tail Speak" reference was provided to assist with figuring the kitties' moods. Despite someone getting swiped at by a kitty that's ready for her forever home (was already adopted), all of them were just precious. 

As for the tea that I tried, Green Hojicha, it had a wonderful earthly taste and did wonders for my sniffles. I am allergic to cats but yet I love them so much and will suffer the allergies to cuddle them. Staff there was very friendly and so sweet with the kitties. The place was very clean, even cleaner than most places without animals; I was even willing to walk into the restroom inside the kitty room without my shoes. I'm glad that there were humidifies throughout the place, it definitely helped my allergies a little bit.

Final Thoughts: I left here with my allergies full blown and heart warmed with kitty cuddles. I could've have been happier, only if my allergies would be less haha.
author: Vania C.

description:
The cats are SO cute! 

I've been to cat cafes in Japan, and the experience is a little different, but if you love kitties and want to spend some time with them, KitTea is the place to be. We went during Happy Meow-r, which came out to about 15 a person but it is normally more expensive. With the reservation, you also get free green tea, sourced straight from Kyoto. I would suggest making a reservation online, as time slots are limited to make sure the cats aren't overwhelmed by people.

Overall, I had fun petting the cats. Didn't try the food because it was a bit overpriced but the tea was okay. If you're just here for the cats it's a good experience. The staff was kind and also helpful.
author: Beatrice F.

description: We did an hour session which came with bottomless green tea (your pick of three kinds). The hosts was great and introduced us to all the resident cats. The cats were a mix of curious / playful / sleepy and cuddly.
author: Christine K.

description: This place was super cool!!  We took my daughter for her birthday because she's a crazy cat lady and she was in HEAVEN.  The fire alarm happened to go off while we were there, and even though it wasn't that big of an inconvenience, the owner (assuming) felt so bad that he refunded half our money. It totally wasn't necessary, but speaks to great ownership and customer service. If you're a cat lover, check this place out!!
author: Amber H.

description:
This embodies everything that's wrong with the city. Monetize or die, basically. 

In more detail, prices are through the roof. $20 to spend an hour basically doing them a service by socializing their cats? Cats which, I might add, have already been socialized to death by the last stampeding horde of people willing to fork over money (money earned by performing the vital human service of pushing ads to people in tech companies, one imagines) to be ignored, and therefore stopped caring about humans since they've realized there will always be an overabundance of them? Another $10+ for food. Oh and then they try to make us pay EVEN more to buy treats for the cats. Included tea is admittedly good but not $20 good, not even $10 good. Maybe $4 good. 

Then, there's some prissy, saccharine and ingenuine-seeming girl who's somehow (probably the fact that the business takes in 100s of dollars per hour by doing essentially nothing is a clue) paid to do essentially nothing but scrutinize and offer nosy, unwanted comments on every last thing that occurs in the room, and also enforce a slew of paranoid rules. Hey, animal behavior genius, maybe I don't want your interpretation of what the cat is thinking right now. Maybe I came here, to, gee, I dunno... see CATS.
author: Isaac J.

description: Super fun and unique experience. Space is a little cramped, but the cats make it all worthwhile.
author: Catharine C.

description:
Great cause and tasty teas. How can you not love kitty cuddle time?

Make a reservation online, because the chances of a walk-in (especially in days following their opening) are slim. It's $25 for an hour of playtime with bottomless Japanese teas. 

Cats aside, the teas were actually pretty fantastic. Hot, soothing, and pretty much perfect. 

The staff do a good job of giving you a heads up of how to treat the kitties and how to refill your tea/snacks (you can order with a staff member and your goods will arrive at a window). A pretty good, mellow time, with of course, the slight scent of cat. Do not expect millions of kittens running over you; on the contrary, there are just a handful of cats (ages will range depending on what cats come in from the rescue they work with) and they may or may not be too sleepy to care for your existence.

You know, like a normal cat.

ALL of the cats are available for adoption, and they are all such sweethearts. It's hard to walk away from purr machines!

EXCELLENT staff and volunteers, delicious tea, and sanitary space. I love it!
author: Colleen M.

description: The folks at Kittea Cafe really went out of their way to make my daughter feel special.  We came in on her birthday and she ordered the waffle sundae.  It was huge and delicious!  We both enjoyed hanging out with the kitties and having our tea.  Thank you to everyone at Kittea and to the other guests enjoying the cats with us for making her feel so good on her special day!
author: Angie M.

description:
I was lucky enough to come by during the soft opening for investors and neighbors earlier this week. And they are rumored to have their grand opening June 8th, if all goes well with inspection and such.

The place itself: 
-They have 2 rooms. One for just enjoying a cup of tea and another for relaxing with the cats. In the cat room, you can also drink your tea too.
-Really cozy, clean and open atmosphere
-Good sized rooms

The cats:
-They currently have 8 cats (2 kittens to my knowledge), they are also available for adoption
-They let 2-4 cats/kittens out at a time and in rotation, so the cats don't get overwhelmed
-Some were friendly and some were shy. Just give them some time :)

The Tea Menu:
-Hojicha Sun ($11/pot): roasted Sencha
-Genmaicha ($10/pot): a blend of Bancha green tea, roasted with Mochi rice
-Sencha Wind ($11/pot): "more on the sweet side"
-Matcha ($12/bowl): produced with Uji Hikari leaves

The service:
-All of the employees and volunteers were really friendly and knowledgeable. They really care about the cats
-You can make a reservation through their website (when it becomes available). This is to avoid overcrowding of Kittea
-Walk-ins will also be available depending on how busy it is at a time

I will frequent KitTea to get my dose of kitten cuddles every now and then, since I live close by. Make sure to make reservations, this place might get really busy.
author: Solongo B.

description: We scheduled ahead for an hour in the cat lounge. It was super relaxing with the unlimited green tea and kitties, can't wait to go back
author: Tiana S.

description:
I would give the place 4 and a half stars actually, the reason being I believe my one issue with the place is a minor one at best. That being, the food and tea is a tad pricey (though many teas are free and bottomless with a reservation!). Primarily, I think the focus should be on the cats. This is an adoption-oriented place, and the workers are focused on helping you get to know the cats, at which I think they do a great job. Furthermore, the cost of reservations/appointments and the food, I assume, goes toward the facilities. It's San Francisco, which isn't cheap, and it is a beautiful facility; I personally think it's an incredible cause to house cats during the day in a clean, spacious area while allowing a limited number of people to come in and interact with them. 

First and foremost, the people who visit KitTea should be people who understand cats- cats are NOT dogs. Yes, these cats are friendly and adorable and wonderful, but they're still not dogs. You have to approach them, and don't complain that the cats are often sleeping. That's just what they do, especially when tired in the afternoon. Go in the morning if you want to play with active cats!
author: Julianne W.

description:
The venue was organized and clean. I was given clear instructions on how the hour would play out which I appreciated. Our Cat Wrangler was great! She gave us tips on how the cats liked to play and when the cats were sleepy she brought out treats to help them engage with us. 

I played, pet, and gave treats to every cat there. All were very sweet and had their own personalities. Fun experience I would definitely do again. I went on a Saturday at 1:00PM. My hour was completely full, but I still felt I got plenty of cat interaction. Don't be afraid to sit on the floor to interact with the cats! I noticed people who only stayed in their seat got less cat interaction. I went back in forth between sitting on the floor to play/ pet the cats and then heading back to my seat (to make room for other people to play w/the cats as well). I did notice a few people stayed exclusively in one spot on the floor which I found inconsiderate. 

Next time I go, I will try for mid-week or later in the day on a weekend and see if there are less people there (which could mean even more cat attention)!
author: Irina R.

description:
Went here with my friends just this afternoon with a reservation made online. When we came in we were greeted with a welcoming hello, which was nice since it was our first time, and the front desk told us how everything worked and had us in the tea lounge while we wait for our turn in the cat lounge. The cat lounge reserved online is $20/person with an unlimited amount of their green teas. As we got into the cat lounge, we were introduced to the cat wrangler (i forgot her name. sorry!) who continued the process with how to treat the cats, and food/drinks info. She always checked in on us asking if we wanted any food or tea, and if anyone had questions, she was very knowledgeable. Okay, time for the part people want to actually know about: the cats.

They are the most adorable and the most friendly cats I've met. There were about 16 today, and most were sleeping at first but about the 2nd half hour they started playing with us a lot more. I guess if you smell like dog they wont really try to play with you since only 1/3 of us were successful in attracting the cats. Nonetheless, they were really playful and energetic. One cat even hopped on my lap and smothered its face in my jacket! So cute! 

Despite it being quite pricey, it's well worth it. The employees and cats are all friendly in quiet and bright environment. The tea was delicious and the merch is adorable too (if you're willing to pay extra). They also have other event like Yoga with Cats and Mewvie night! So, whether you're looking to adopt or to just hang around the cats, definitely look into this place.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
The concept behind this store is cute ~ but the whole "cafe" set up was very disappointing . 1. The cafe and the cat area are two different places. The only reason it is called cat cafe is because you can  order food when you get inside of the cat room . 
In order to get into the cat room, you have to make a reservation (walk ins are hard) and pay a $25 / hr fee . This comes with a pot of tea tho and some of the money goes towards animal shelters (I believe) .

Anyways , do not expect to have the right to pet the cats just because you eat and drink there.

I wouldn't recommend anyone going there just for the food. 

But it's a cute idea overall!
author: Li S.

description: Super fun cat café in San Francisco. I went for the Thursday happy hour, which is slightly more fordable for a one hour reservation spot. Paid $15, which included one free beverage. The swag there is super cute but a little bit pricey however the proceeds go to cat adoption agencies. That cat lounge is a little bit cramped but they have very cute cat furniture and lounge chairs for the humans.
author: Chang J.

description: We had a wonderful experience at this place. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive to both visitors and residents cats. The teas and cookies are really good. Best of all, you get to spend time and play with a bunch of friendly kitties. It can't get any better that this. I highly recommend visiting this place if you are a cat admirer.
author: Anoosheh T.

description: Such a relaxing way to spend an hour.  $20 feels like a donation to a good cause.  The tea is super high quality and yummy.  Great staff.  A once (or more) in a lifetime must do.
author: Janet K.

description:
$25 to spend an hour with cats along with 11 other people, way too crowded.  But still 5 stars because the cats are super-friendly and soft.  The people who work there, some volunteers, are wonderful.  The tea is delicious!  Well run facility. 

None of the teas included with the $25 is caffeine free.  

The weekend spots filled up quickly.  

Tip : According to the staff, the cats are at their most active in the first and last sessions of the day.
author: Greg B.

description: It's friendly people who care about cats, good tea, and cats. Easy to find, it's set up to make the time with the felines as easy as possible. We had a great time and highly recommend.
author: Mark H.

description:
My GF and I are huge cat people, so this was amazing for us. We sat in a room with the cats and a bunch of toys and two cat caretakers who kept an eye on things. It's a very zen and quite atmosphere. We pet and played with the cats and drank a bunch of green tea (the 25$ per person give you bottomless green tea, from 4 varieties). 

All in all, if I lived in SF, I'd go every 2 or 3 weeks to unwind :)
author: Yousef A.

description: KitTea Cat Cafe was an amazing and unforgettable experience. The tea they served tasted as expected and like any other tea you would get at a Japanese restaurant. The place was very clean, neat, and upkept very well. The cats are friendly, docile, and adoptable. I went with a friend during "Happy Meowr" on Thursday and it was the best $30 ($15 per person) I ever spent! :D
author: Kimiko M.

description: Loved our visit to the kittea cat cafe... very unique and unlike anything we've done. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because the cats didn't seem to want anything to do with us 75% of the time. That is, until the "cat wrangler" brought out handfuls of food for everyone. However, after the food was gone, the cats went back to doing their own thing. Now, I understand that we can't force the cats to give us attention, I think a little downtime for the cats would be appropriate. We had a 12 reservation, and there were groups coming and going before and after us. These cats were getting non-stop attention, which I understand to be slightly overstimulating and exhausting for them. Also, it was a pretty expensive little outing considering that the only thing the $25 pays for us cats and tea. Overall, the experience was fun and it was just nice to be in their presence! Definitely a one time thing for us though.
author: Kyla T.

description:
KitTea is the best! I love that all their cats are adoptable through local rescue partners. The green tea is delicious and comes with the one hour cat lounge visit. You have to try the waffles! They are to die for, seriously. 

The cats are so cute and playful! I love them and will definitely be coming back! Thanks KitTea for a great time!
author: Valerie G.

description: Yes it's expensive. But the tea is high quality and they keep this place super clean. Too many cat related kawaii things to buy! For future reference, look for Dolly Purrton as she is a friendly at who is totally willing to sit on your lap and be petted.
author: Kali D.

description: I am obsessed with this place. Actually that's somewhat of an understatement. The teas are amazing and authentic. This is currently the only cat and tea lounge in San Francisco right now. The staff is so friendly. You can go into the cat Lounge for a small fee and either hangout for 30 minutes or an hour. The cats are also up for adoption! The price point is not bad at all and you know it's going to a great cause. The cats are super well taken care of and all adorable. The place is super clean and well kept. It is such a cool experience coming here. I hope I can find more places like this around other cities! There are small souvenirs you can buy at the front of the store. Everything is priced well. I love the decor of this place. It's super trendy and minimal.
author: Merica K.

description: I have been here twice for mewvie nights and numerous times for regular visits! It is awesome, a great program, very clean, good food at the cafe and good tea! I recommend bringing nothing but tea into the actual cat area. Popcorn is fun for films. Also BUY the cat treats and bring them in!! The cats love them! :) awesome for dates, frienddates, and families!
author: Brittnie P.

description:
I had a fun time at KitTea. With $25, you get to play with their cats for an hour with unlimited green tea refills. The space is very clean and the toilets are amazing - they're Toto toilets and have a seat warmer + bidet. There's a lot of places to sit and toys you can use to play with the cats with. They also have an assortment of books about cats. You can also buy more cat merchandise as soon as you enter the cafe. 
The staff is friendly and they all seem to enjoy their job (but who wouldn't if you're surrounded by cute fluffy animals all day). When we went around 6pm, half the cats were sleeping and half were walking around. Some were eager to play with you and others didn't like to be pet so much. Depends on the cat.
author: Tabitha H.

description: What a great idea!!!!! this place is fantastic.  EVen for people with allergies! Brought my friends daughter as she loves kitties but her mom is allergic - she sits on the inside at the cafe (with great tea and food!)while we got to play with the kitties - they are all so sweet and the people there are just great!  Go get your kitty fix and support a good cause and maybe adopt one of the ones up for adoption!!
author: Cindy D.

description:
LOVE this place! Talk about the cat lover's purrrrfect place to hang out! It's a little busy, so you have to reserve in advance if you want to be on the side of the kitty tea room, but if you're  content watching these gorgeous babies from the other side of the cafe, they have plenty of space! 

The cats are all lovingly friendly and adorable. Some of them are quite playful while others simply prefer to nap on your lap. I wasn't able to go in at the time of my visit and have a sip of tea, but it's definitely on the top of my to do list!
author: Nita C.

description:
I think what they are doing to help cats is wonderful. I went on a Saturday with a friend and it was $25 per person we booked an appointment the  day before. The entire staff was friendly and professional. We got the smoked salmon waffle and had some tea that comes with the visit both were very delicious! I dont think the price is bad I think of it as a donation to help them take care of the kitties & I would love to go again. The whole experience was very relaxing for me.

Also you don't have to pay to see the cats, you can hang out in the cafe and watch them through the window. They also sell some really cute cat merch things like stickers, key chains, enamel pins etc.
So if you wanted to stop by and see a bunch of kitties and enjoy some tea or one of those huge waffles you could do that. 

This is a small shop and during the times when they switch groups in the cat room it does get really crowded. 

I definitly disagree with the reviewer who complained about this place and just wants to play with pugs. Very weird you would go here and write a review if you dont like cats
author: Lizzy C.

description:
I dedicate my 1000th review to KitTea!

I've heard about cat cafes in Asia, but had no idea there was one in SF!  I also thought it was a very Asian thing to do...but to my surprise, we were the only Asians in there!! Workers and other customers! We booked an hour with the cats, not knowing what to expect.  All I knew was: free refills on tea and there are cats.  It really is one of those things that just makes sense when you get there and see it for yourself.

There are two separate rooms, one has the cats and the other is just a cafe.  If you are in the cat room, you can order food and enjoy it there.  If you are on the cafe side, there aren't any cats but you can watch them through the glass wall.  I was reluctant about getting cat hair in my food and tea, but the room is kept very clean and there was no fur in my drank.  Impressive, given that there were over 10 cats in there.  I got  genmaicha- always my fav, and sencha- on the bitter side.  I should've tried the others but I got distracted with the cats.  

If you are in the market to adopt a cat, this would be a good place to check out!  All these cats are up for adoption and are being rehabilitated to go to good homes.  There's a cat wrangler in the room who keeps things in line, but for overall, the cats were well behaved.  I particularly like the mellow cat (Harvey!), but the interactive kitties are really cute to play with too. 

Pro-tips:
*Get there at noon when they open so the cats are refreshed and ready to play, plus it's not as crowded
*I was afraid my clothes were gonna be furry or shredded, so I thought high waisted jeans (no crack cleavage!) were the way to go.  In reality, the cats didn't sit on me so I had no scratches or fur problems. Comfy, functional clothes will do. 
*Check out the bathroom.  The toilet has a bidet.

I am not that big of a cat person, but I do love animals.  It still ended up being therapeutic and enjoyable.  If you ARE a cat lover...well then, my friend, this will be kitty heaven.
author: Lyn C.

description:
Cats, carbs and tea.  What else is there to life?  When I first heard about this cafe and the concept of showcasing some lovely adoptable shelter kitties, my heart melted.  

The cafe met and exceeded my expectations.  It is clean, well managed and is tailored to delight any feline-o-phile! 

The cats are obviously showered with attention and the space is tranquil and kitty friendly.  To actually tea with the kitties, you must make a reservation and pay an entrance fee that is based on time (half hour is the lowest increment of time with the next increment being an hour)  either online or the phone.  Walk-ins are welcome, but depending upon current occupancy, entrance is not guaranteed.  

Tea is included in the full-hour package but not in the half hour package.  Prices are listed clearly on the website.  There is also seating outside of the kitty room if occupancy is full,  which allows guests to tea without cover charge and watch the kitties frolick with humans.

Yet, what's the fun in being a voyeur?  I'd rather be in on the action!  Kitty squishes!!!!

They also host neat events, such as, yoga with the kitties and movie night with the kitties... Purr-fect!
author: Hiromi N.

description: The cats were so adorable and lovable. The ginger tabby cats were my personal favorites but all of them were so cute. On weekdays the price is $20 per person, overall an amazing experience and would definitely recommend to any animal lovers!
author: Miu K.

description:
Funny how we ended up here when I don't really like cats all that much and he's allergic.. 

Anyways, there's a huge window at the front of the cafe where you can peek through and watch all the little kitties WISHING you were in there. That's how they lure ya in!! We made a reservation for 7-8pm which came out to be $52 for 2 people. You might think, "YOU GOTTA BE KITTEN ME (lol get it)?" when you're asked to pay that much to drink tea and pet kittens. My roommate has a cat at my apartment so if you ask why we paid that much.. it's because I'm all for new experiences so why the heck not? 

We checked in right before our reservation and waited for the previous session to finish up cuddling up with the kittens. The price we paid included an hour with the kittens and complimentary tea. There were only three green tea flavors that were included, but there were plenty of other things on the menu to try as well. We waited in the cafe area until it was our turn to go in. We were asked to take off our shoes before we entered and sanitized our hands. There were about 12 people total in the room and maybe 8-10 cats roaming around. There was also one instructor inside to make sure all the kittens were being treated properly and to answer any questions. My favorite kitten was Pocket just because she was so small and cute!! She was sleepy when we first got here and wouldn't budge, but suddenly jumped up with energy and ran away after a while! All the cats seemed very calm, probably because we came at the end of the day and they were tired from the all day long human interactions. There was a tiny room you could enter where there were two small kittens who weren't ready to be with the other kittens. They were still young and not ready for that kinda exposure yet. They were adorable! 

Cool concept, but something I'd only try once just because I'm not a huge cat lover. Not sure if they have any other cafes like this in the area, but it would be great if they had a puppy cafe.. I know that Seoul has tons of animal cafes (raccoons, sheep, puppy, etc..). The cafe puts its kittens up for adoption, so if you fall in love with one while you're there, you might just have a new furry friend to take home with ya!
author: Sydney C.

description: Friendly staff and plenty of kitties to pet! Unfortunately we went at 2pm and majority of the kitties were all napping... we couldn't hold or play with them but they let you pet them while they are napping!
author: Annie H.

description: make sure you call ahead... i had told my daughter about this magical place where they had cats you can play with and we were so excited to go here...... on a saturday at noon it was closed for a private event. my daughter was literally devastated, she actually cried from the disappointment. this made me feel horrible for building it up so much just to let her down. we had driven for a hour to go there. even when the man opened the door for us and we explained we had driven an hour he couldn't let us in. seriously????!!!!
author: Willow M.

description: Purrfect place for my daughter's Sweet 16. Waffles were delicious and kitties were happy to see us.
author: Katy K.

description:
So Much FUN!

I went by myself, and didn't hesitate one minute. 

From the very beginning, everyone welcomed me in with great smiles and open arms. Akiko was awesome. All the cats were friendly, and very sleepy too. 

Will definitely comeback again!

Thanks!
author: Jae P.

description: The cats are pretty well-socialized (by cat standards, anyway), and the included teas are pretty tasty. That's enough to keep me coming back.
author: Patrick Y.

description: So Sweet with all of the cats there! Some are super friendly and others want to nap, but it was fun
author: Y. T.

description:
Congradulation on the being the first cat cafe in san francisco! I am so glad it finally happens. Over the world there are many cat cafe. The experience is once in a life time. I think kittea has a very good business model. Their ultimate goal in the end satisfy multiple purposes. Whether you are looking for a good cup of tea in a room full of cat, or you are looking to adopt a cat in a safe environment, or both! You will definitely enjoy this establishment.
To visit the cat area, I made a reservation through their website. Weekend is slightly more expensive than weekdays. It includes an hour to play with the cats, and bottomless green tea (other drinks and food will cost extra). If you arrive the area early, I do recommend to visit their lounge. You can get you food and/or drink first, also sit next to the huge window which faces the cat area. Once it's your time, they will ask you to take off the shoes and coat, and head into the cat room. Once inside, they will introduce you to the cats, also which ones are available to adopt.
We spent the first 30 minutes taking pictures of the cat, tried to pet and play with each one. All of them are very good with human, but not to each other cats. You can see how they become territorial after a while, especially the new comer.

Overall was a fun experience. 30 bucks per person for weekend is a bit steep. Parking is hectic in hayes valley so come early! Parking meter is $2 an hour, garage prices varies
author: Gary C.

description: Absolutely loved it! The cats are so friendly + want to play with you. The staff were very professional and I loved how they had a passion for helping cats. I purchased the $20 reservation and with it you receive unlimited tea! How awesome, right? They also have cool swag up in the front so I purchased a cat pin, sticker and socks! You're definitely not going to regret it.
author: Melissa T.

description:
