author: Natalie K.

description: $20 per person for a cup of tea and a hour to spend with the cats.. slightly overpriced..
author: Cikeyona Z.

description: Great place! I hope to be back again whenever I visit San Fran!
author: Wendy E.

description:
This is the best cat adoption / tea house that I have been to.

Oolong was pretty good
author: Garrett S.

description:
My friend and I came here the second month it was open (definitely make a reservation!) and it was a sold out hour. The staff are friendly and helpful in terms of explaining the rules and overall experience. The entire place has a very peaceful vibe and I liked that there was a tea room separate from the cats in case you are just looking to observe the cats. Their tea list is pretty extensive and I would come back just to try a few of their offerings. 

Obviously, being the crazy cat lady that I am, I could not wait to get into the cat room and dreamed of all of the cats crawling all over me. Unfortunately, since we're talking about cats, this was not the case. A lot of the cats were either sleeping (do not disturb!) or totally skittish. While I was expecting this to be the case, I did find the human to cat ratio to be a bit off. I feel like they should plan for some of the cats to be sleeping/hiding and therefore increase the number of cats per hour. 

I can't believe I'm about to say this, but here it goes (no judgements please): I was a bit surprised/upset about the unwillingness of other people to 'share' the cats. Let me explain - there were four kittens in the room that day, and clearly everyone went straight for them. There was a group of three women who scooped them up at the beginning and proceeded to hold on to them for the entire duration of our time. Yes, the full hour. I'm not going to lie, I was pretty upset. It's a very strange dynamic when you have to ask a grown woman to share her kitten with you. I ended up not saying anything and sending evil glares in their direction. I wish the attendants/staff members in the room had picked up on it and had worked out a better system in which everyone has time with the cats. Sadly, not being able to actually engage with the kittens kind of ruined the experience for me, and I'm not sure I'd go back. 

With that said, I think it's a wonderful idea and certainly a great cause. Just beware of the kitten hogs!!
author: Regina L.

description:
Cats. Oh my god. I can't believe I've never checked this place out before!

I tried the kitty yoga tonight, and am definitely interested in trying Saturday morning cartoons with cats soon!
author: Pam G.

description: I loved every minute of this darling cafe ! So clean , delicious menu and the kitties seem as happy as can be .
author: K M.

description: I honestly really do love cats. I loved to play with them, it's just so overpriced. For us, we went on a weekend, so for an hour, 25 bucks. I loved being around the cats, and the tea was decent. It's just, for 25 bucks, I'd hoped to be able to get a bit more. An hour passes by really quickly, and with 11 other people playing with the cats, I spent more time spectating than interacting. If it  was 15 dollars, or there were less people, I'd be giving a much higher review. I just got less than what I'd hoped for.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I am allergic to cats. But I have always wanted to go to a cat cafe. And I'm pretty sure my allergy is starting to go away. I do love tea, though, and it is in my best interests to go to every tea shop in San Francisco, and the whole WORLD...so yeah, I had to go to KitTea. Also, puns.

To be honest, it's kind of a weird concept in America, though I know it's not so weird elsewhere (see: Japan). I probably should've done some research and made sure that all the money I spent would go toward the cats. I mean, I'm sure it does, but someone please correct me if I'm wrong.

The tea was excellent. I have the hojicha at home, but their genmaicha was actually the one I liked the best. The sencha was all right. I can get better stuff at a proper tea shop.

Prices are steep, but if you can get in on a weekday, I recommend doing that as it's a bit cheaper. Also, you can just come and have food and watch the cats from behind the glass in the cafe, which is probably something I'd do in the future. The $20/person price is only if you want to go into the cat room. But let's be real...you're thinking about going to KitTea BECAUSE you want to play with the cats. Think about this. Think. About. This.

And that $20 is probably a wise investment if you're looking to own a neko of your own to atsume. This way, you can see if the animals have a natural affinity to you. That's important. There are only two cats in the world that like me and I am okay with that, and neither of them were here, but I liked drinking cats and watching tea. Or...wait. Reverse that.

Anyway. It's a thing to do in the city for cat lovers. Also, the lady behind the counter's name is KANEKO. THE PUNS DON'T END.
author: Robbin A.

description:
There's nothing better than kitties and tea! I wanted to come to this place so much that I waited 3 hours to get in! At first I didn't know that it was better to make a reservation before going in and I just tried walking in. So learn from
My mistake- make a reservation first! 
  They operate in 30-1 hr intervals in which they send a group in every 30 mins. You get to pick if you want to stay for 30 mins or an hour. It's about 15$/ 30 mins and about $25/ 1 hour! The good thing is that, while you're in there, theres unlimited tea refills! They have a lot of good teas (especially Japanese teas). I got their sencha and their genmai! Not bad! Also you get to pet the kitties!! Worth every penny! 

    -tip: they have stamp cards!
author: Janet K.

description:
Wonderful!!! I've been to another cat town across the bay too, and Kittea is much more inviting and welcoming.  Really beautiful inside. They made a big jungle gym for the cats, and a bunch of fun playground looking equipment for the purposes of frolicking and adorableness. And the best part is, they are finding homes for kitties!

As far as the food, it was pretty awesome. I had the waffle with fennel and salmon and goat cheese on it, for 9 bucks, and it was delicious and filled me up.
author: Luke T.

description: I love cats I love tea! So many lil cuties with all different styles and personalities. Good kitties.
author: Emily B.

description: A very unique only in San Francisco experience.  Very relaxing. They have two sections : one is a cafe. The other side is the "cat side" for which it's highly recommended to make a reservation since for the cats sake they limit the number of humans that can be with the cats for one hour to 12. You also get a bottomless green tea. They have four varieties which are very good. Altogether a very chill way to spend an afternoon. This concept works very well!
author: Kamal A.

description: This is an excellent experience for people who want to hang out with kitties and eat wonderful waffles and drink bottomless tea for an hour. However, the reason I cannot give this place a 5 star review is because I kept noticing a child picking up cats, who obviously showed a dislike for being picked up, and the behaviorist in the room did nothing about it. One cat in particular that I saw this happen with over and over again was Aunt Gail, a senior cat who is up for adoption. She would meow and try to escape from this child, and of course the child would put her back down. But this child was relentless and I really felt bad for this sweet cat. I also felt as though there were too many people in the room at once, which may have led this child to look for attention from a cat that was not suited for her energy level. The one thing keeping this experience from being worthy of 5 stars would be the people-to-cats ratio. I feel like the environment would be better for both humans and cats if the amount of people in the room was limited, or the amount of cats was increased.
author: Casy T.

description:
On the pricier end compared to neighboring cat cafe Cat Town in Oakland, but understandably so--I'm glad they're in the city proper and able to pay what must be really expensive rent. It costs $14 for a half-hour in the cat area, but you can always go grab a bite without visiting the resident animals themselves.

KitTea's interior is cute as a button, replete with great gifts (prints, tweet socks, hand-made cat toys, etc.), and the cafe portion features some delicious-sounding food and drinks. I spent the entirety of my visit petting a big boy named Turbo, whose girth was, um, a little wide, but he looked so dapper spread out on one of their shibori cushions that I would've taken him home if I didn't already have my own kittehs.

Thanks for the work you do, KitTea! I hope you find homes for all the cities lonely fur-babies.
author: Linnie G.

description: Today we came in for the first time and had a great experience. My 6 year old has been begging to come drink tea and play with kitties! The staff is friendly, tea was tasty, and the kitties are adorable and very active!! Thanks KitTea, for a great experience today!!
author: Season B.

description: Liked this place a lot, food was ok. Overall place is pretty small and at times may feel congested.
author: Arjun H.

description: The employees at KitTea are all cat lovers, and they successfully wrangle both people and cats, providing excellent guidance on how to interact with unfamiliar cats.  The cats are outgoing and friendly, but not gooey.  The tea is delicious, as is the food, but $25 per hour, paid in advance at the time of our reservation in the lobby, is a little too pricey.  Finally, the bathroom must be visited for the electric, high-tech loo!
author: Sg L.

description:
I went at 5pm, there were probably only 6 or 7 cats, all a little older. They seemed pretty tired and not interested. Everyone jumped to play with any of the ones that had a little energy, so it was a little overwhelming for them and underwhelming for me.

But I'd probably give it another try if a friend was interest because your experience is definitely dependent on the time of day, amount of cats available, and people in the space with you.
author: Brooke W.

description:
Very disppointed! After working a long week, I surprised my partner to come to this place. Looking forward for a unique experience.  Finding out that they didn't have me down on the list,  but charged my card! Earlier that week, I called them to verify and no one called me back. They blamed their website Soshi's marketing and vendor. Never again will I come here. Unprofessional and take responsibility of your mistakes. Ruined my day. Thank you!

Hello for your response.

When my check credit card statement comes then I will check if I got charged.  After paying for two tickets on your online page, it stated on that webpage that it charged my card.  When I didn't get an email from your company, I got worried so I called on Monday after 1 pm and I left a message on the phone # listed in your YELP page. I waited for your response.  I'm not sure what happen, but hopefully we can reconcile it. 

I was very disappointed that night, especially talking about your business concept to my friends the whole week as well as surprising my partner, Jovi for our date night. 

As for your comment of staying, I read in your website that if there's too many people in the room then it will affect the kittens/cats. Jovi and I didn't want to cause them any anxiety so we decided to leave. As for trying another night, we will see.  That night just left me with a bad impression of the professionalism of your business.  As a cat lover, I will try to change my mind.  Thank you for responding. ML
author: Maria Lourdes N.

description: This is a nice clean place with cheerful staff and lots of cats to pet. When I went, though, most of them were sleeping and we were told not to wake sleeping cats. I think $20 is a lot to pay for free green tea and the chance to pet some kitties. While I enjoyed it, it was a luxury I can't afford to do again.
author: Julie M.

description:
I went with my cousin on a Monday noon. We had no reservation but they were able to fit us in.

*** PRICES ***
- Very pricey: $25 for an hour with unlimited tea; we only had a cup
- You can get a stamp card, the 6th visit is free

*** CATS ***
- They had about 6 cats out and I feel like there were more people than cats available 
- Since some cats are napping/ sleeping, they weren't up to play right away

*** FACILITY/ STAFF ***
- Very clean facility: I'm slightly allergic to cats so if the room is not clean, I'll start sneezing right away. But here it was only 40 mins in that I sneezed a couple of times, which shows the air is properly ventilated and they keep it clean
- Staff: friendly but they had 2 staff inside the room supervising. It was slightly awkward because they were just standing there... 

Overall this is probably my last time visiting, TBH I prefer my volunteering shift at the Humane Society more. It's free, you get unlimited time with cats, and you are contributing back to the community.
author: Mengerie S.

description: I've visited several(!) cat cafes in Tokyo long before this place opened in SF. I was very excited to hear that it was opening here and waited with anticipation. I love that some of the cats are residents and some are newbies who can be adopted. They've facilitated nearly 200 adoptions so far! They have interesting events, which I haven't tried yet, like movie nights and yoga. The place is clean and the cats look healthy. And they have delicious waffles and other dishes in the cafe, which is separate from the animal area. Unfortunately I didn't feel it was a relaxing or warm environment and on top of the hourly minimum fee (no discount for a shorter visit), the snacks for the cats are super expensive. Nearer to closing time, the cats are less and less interested in the humans even if you have snacks so if you are nearby at that time, it's free to peek through the window from the eating area.
author: Marina N.

description: Took my 12 year old daughter here with her friends and they all really enjoyed it.  The staff was knowledgeable, helpful and courteous.  Would definitely recommend it!
author: Michelle S.

description: It was great hanging out with kitties and cats while drinking tea. Love all the cats and kitties and great merchandise.
author: Pamela M.

description:
This was lame. Overpriced $20 an hour to chase after cats that don't want to play with you. They were mostly sleeping or running away. Not enough cats to people in the room. They can not serve tea to you, it was frustrating, I would finally get a cat to play with sat down then I had to leave to pick up my own yea at a window. Waste of time and I lost my kitty to play with. I ended up standing in the back closet area where the cat toilet and laundry area is to play with two cats hiding. Sorry not my cup of tea. 

Pros the guy in the room was very friendly, all other staff was not that nice. 
The cats have a chance to get adopted
That's it, tea was just ok.
author: Karen T.

description:
Located on a very not so calm part of town where parking is a nightmare and 80% of the parking meters are red zoned almost all day when people are alive, its quite a nightmare to suggest that such a place would really want to find itself here in downtown instead of a calmer location like the sunset or richmond district...less red zoned meters too.

KitTea opens from 11-8 if i remember correctly, however be warned. Before you venture here, check the prices and availability cause if they Are full you will be turned away.

A)For those who book appts. or come in between the times of 2-6pm, there is a high chance of you spending $50+for an hour of sipping tea next to sleeping cats. If we wanted to see that, just look up a tree really.

Don't get me wrong, its nice to know that the cats have somewhere to be instead of on the street looking for scraps or on 280 as roadkill but for those few hours, for the price people pay, i don't think they will come back. Particularly those who did not receive a code to use during the funding stage of kittea.(-1)

B) The cafe staff is more than hesitant or reluctant depending on how you perceive the staff members demeanor. If your appt time has not yet arrived, they prefer not to serve any drinks to you other than something that could pass for tap water.

In my mind that just sounds like someone trying to limit their inventory costs by only serving to those who are inside with the cats. But at the same time, it sounds ...for lack of a better term....dumb....

For the most part people do see the price tags on the small appetizer length menu they place at each table. But if you don't want people ordering till they are inside, why have it out to begin with?

Its like opening the front doors to a gentlemen's' club at 8am but no shows or entertainers are going to be on stage until 6pm that night... Why bother having it out if theres nothing to be put out? (-1)

C) The cats are people friendly, and aren't too shy about being held by strangers, the little ones will squirm away to the sun while the big ones just look at you with a " what the hell do you want? Cant you see I'm sleeping?" Face.. (+1)

D) The human bathrooms are clean, and they have what loos like toto toilets so at least the environment is clean for both.(+1)


In closing, if you dont mind paying nearly the price of two steaks from HOPR to sit with cats and drink tea that does not stand out from what can be found in chinatown, then this may be the place for you to go to.

If you would rather spend your money on food, GoKart Racing or anything else in the city. I totally understand.

Biggest turn off for people i spoke to outside of their establishment including the person who took me here was the price....

Seriously 50 dollars per hour? I think some people just looked at the Movie ticket prices in a whole different light because of it..

Reasoning for two star review : For those of us not working for apple, google or Deloitte, 50 dollars can really make a  big difference in your weekly plans,especially with the cost of living in sf, whether its the TL or the Sunset. 

For those people who did not get codes because they didn't donate during the funding phase, that price tag will turn them off more than a sweet toothed kid staring at vegan brownies.

For those who are curious to what the asian standard of a cat-house/cat shelter looks like, look on google: kitty/cat house in japan. Its like chuckie cheese for them.
author: Eric C.

description:
Whats better than cats
Cats sitting with you while you drink tea

Even people like me with allergies wanna go (thank God for allergy pills)

Very cute
Very cuddly
author: C.I G.

description: My son loves to come here and play with the cats.  I love the green teas.  We both love to eat the waffles with Nutella and berries.  An hour goes by fast.  Everything is very clean and there isn't any cat smell.  The cats are lovely.  One criticism is that the food ordering gets a bit backed up. By the time I ordered a waffle, it still hadn't come by the end of the session and I had to take it to go.  You can order food with your reservation but sometimes, you just want to see what it looks like or see how you feel before you order.  I think orders should be done within the first 20 min of the session and they should be given first priority over those just sitting in the cafe.  I also feel that while the cafe and cat lounge area are very clean, it doesn't get a lot of natural light so it can feel somewhat sterile, cold and dark.  Other than that, it is an interesting idea that allows rescued cats to be adopted and enjoyed.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I would not recommend this place. I haven't been to other cat cafes, but the there were many problems here.

The tea was expensive, $8+ a glass for most of them, and they weren't all that great. This is most likely supplemented by the fact that  you get unlimited tea when you book time with cats. They also didn't have any non-tea drinks, so if you like Coffee, you're out of luck.

The actual cats part was okay. We went mid-afternoon at 3 o'clock and all the cats were asleep, or they were all crowded in one area, and that area was crowded by 1 group. The main issue here is that there were too many people during our appointment time, and so few cats to play with. This isn't a fault of the cats, but rather the human who aren't recognising the overcrowding of people.

Overall I'd skip this place if you really want to play with cats as you aren't going to be able to do that.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
This cafe/cat space is:

1) Peaceful -- Dozens of rescue cats with no prior acquaintance in a room? Whisper-quiet. They're often napping in someone's lap or on one of many high perches. Most are friendly and playful and the ones who aren't have private places to hang out.

2) Clean -- Dozens of rescue cats in a room? I've been here a couple times and it always smells and looks meticulously cleaned.

3) Delicious -- Oh, there's these scones that they serve warm with clotted cream, jam, and tea that are really quite a bit better than anything I can seem to find at a regular cafe.

All in all, this place is a fantastic aberration of a spot that I hope to see more of. More cat cafes, less startups. :-D
author: Alee K.

description: Everything here was amazing.  The cats were well cared for, the staff were pleasant, tea was delicious and the place was so clean.  My friend and I got a one hour slot, but most of the cats were asleep because it was around 2 and a party of teens were right before us.  Tuckered them out.  I really enjoyed the serene feeling of all the cats being very calm and napping so it didn't bother me, but if you want to interact with them a lot, go earlier in the day for sure.
author: rocky b.

description:
(4.5) Visited Kittea a few months ago and had a great time! Basically, you pay $25.00 (though I have head their prices have increased) to hang out in a room with cats for an hour. They serve tea and snacks in the cat room at additional cost. All of the cats you meet are adoptable (which is awesome), though it did seem like the cats were overwhelmed by the number of people and the amount of attention in the room.

This place is a "must" for SF cat lovers.

I recently noticed ads for yoga classes held at Kittea. Sounds awesome, though I have not tried them.

UPDATE: the Cats on Mats yoga class is awesome. Good cat-to-human ratio and the instruction itself is solid. One hour vinyasa flow, followed by 30 minutes of tea and time with the cats. Gilt City offered a discount on this class so keep an eye out for similar offers.
author: Irina P.

description: This place was amazing. I went with two of my friends and we had a blast. The staff are all extremely nice and they are great wth getting the cats to interact with you. The drinks are tasty and the food looked amazing (didn't get a chance to try any). Though if you want to visit this place, you want to make a reservation in advance since the stops fill up quickly. Also there doesn't seem to be a ton of parking near by, so either uber, lyft, or take public transit to this place. I definitely want to come back again.
author: Alexis L.

description:
Came here on the weekend in the morning.  High quality tea!  High quality cats!  Very well thought out and loved watching and playing with the cats.  If you like cats, it doesn't get any better than this.

Can't wait to see the food and pastries they'll have available.
author: Louis A.

description:
KitTea is exactly what you'd imagine and hope for: drinking delicious tea while playing with cats! 

I already volunteer at the SPCA, but it can be so soothing to just go to KitTea after work (when the SPCA is closed) and get your cat cuddles on. I went during the soft opening, so they weren't officially open yet, but you could already feel how much love and effort went into this place. The reservation process itself was super easy. I had to reschedule my visit at one point, and it was easy and straightforward. The KitTeam (stealing that from another review) was super friendly, and loved telling stories about the cats and the cafe itself. 

I had a pot of the Sencha Wind, which was delicious. I didn't get to try any of their baked goods, though.

The person:cat ratio was pretty high when I was there, but the cats wander around enough that it was easy to play with most of them in my allocated hour. The space itself is highly conducive to interacting with the cats; they have chairs and poofs of all heights, and the tables are covered in feather toys, laser pointers, and beds. My favorite part is definitely that giant hamster (or I suppose cat) wheel in the front! If you're lucky, you'll get to see one of the kittens run on it for a second. It's probably a good thing it's $25 an hour, or else I'd be there every night!
author: Allison M.

description: This is a fantastic little place with good food and ADORABLE cats. I am an extreme cat lover and I love this cat cafe. The cats do like their space sometimes, but what cats don't. This cafe is has great felines who maybe don't want to be picked up, but love a scratch behind the ears. I recommend it highly.
author: Jupiter J.

description:
I had a lovely time here at KitTea with an old friend of mine! We booked an hour slot. It felt like time flew by.

Now, lots of reviewers have already mentioned that the kittens do get tired out if you go in for a middle of the day session. However, it seems they have mostly young kittens now so chances are there will be always be a few active ones pouncing around.

The tea was nice, and I ordered a spinach feta quiche which was wonderful. One of the kitties tried to steal the garnish off my quiche and I thought that was the most adorable thing ever :P
author: Melody S.

description:
I would not recommend this place. This place is ridiculously EXPENSIVE! I paid $30 for half an hour so that my two children and I can be with some cats. Most cats also slept. Only two were awake and they weren't interested in playing. So we definitely did not get much for our money.
The waffles are $11. Don't go there. It's just about money not the cats.
author: Barbara B.

description: It was as much fun as we hoped! We got to pet lots of kitties, and the tea and special waffle were delicious. Excellent website by the way. We made reservation late in the day as suggested, so the kitties were very active and playful, so entertaining!
author: Kathleen H.

description: One of the most amazing experiences! This is a must if you're in the city. Be sure to book in advance. The cats are for adoption and the handler is very knowledgeable. Be sure to buy the treats at the front desk to be the most popular guest.
author: Toni A.

description: Place was very cozy & has plenty of space. Food was delicious, tea was good. The cats are adorable & it was great to play with them for an hour. I wish our group was smaller because for the amount of cats there were a few too many people but other than that the experience was awesome
author: Viktoriya D.

description:
I visited Kit Tea on a weekday at three p.m. so I didn't have to compete with many other people for socializing time with the cats. The space is bathed in natural light and the I enjoyed a great matcha chai at the cafe. I have visited Purringtons in Portland which has more of a punk vibe while Kit Tea angles towards a Japanese clean and curio vibe. 

I think a lot of people come to Kit Tea as a novelty but some of us actually come here with real thoughts of adopting a pet. A cat cafe is an ideal environment for adoption because the cats are relaxed and already demonstrate the ability to share real estate with other cats. 

There are plenty of places in SF to enjoy a quality scone(Arizmendi!) but consider coming here if you are really interested in giving a cat a forever home.
author: Lisa R.

description: Went with my daughter for an hour at 4pm to visit the kitties. I believe they were all resident cats. At this time of day, the cats were not playful. They basically slept or avoided being handled because I'm sure they were petted, picked up or smothered for hours already. We were glad to see that the $40 we had paid was for a good cause though. My daughter doesn't drink tea so she purchased a small cup of hot chocolate which cost almost $6.00. I don't think we will visit again, but it was an interesting concept and I hope they continue rescuing cats.
author: Veronica K.

description: My 13 year son and 17 year old daughter wanted to take grammy, an ardent cat lover, on a special outing for an early birthday present. (It was our second visit). This was the perfect choice for my mother who can't wait to go back. It was simply a splendid experience! The ambience is warm and inviting. The whimsical  decor is fun and colorful. We enjoyed Belgian waffle banana split sundaes and endless green tea. The cats were the true stars of the afternoon. We were delighted that they were so active and the hour flew by. I especially enjoyed feeding a few while my children played with the more interactive ones. One of the wranglers introduced us to all of the cats and entertained us with interesting stories about some of their escapades. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. It was a truly memorable experience.
author: Kathleen L.

description: the best part is the second half of the hour when the food came out and then the cats came out of their hiding places :):):)   Great Staff!!!
author: Charles M.

description: Wonderful first expurrrience.. Made my daughter's 17th birthday purrrfect, and we loved the tea! Only complaint is that Kit Tea is too far away, making it a fairly expensive visit for us. Please consider branching out all over the Bay... East Bay would be a great direction to start!
author: Marisa P.

description: Kit-Tastic! You can't but help to fall in love with all of the cute cuties! The space was beautifully designed and it was cat cuteness overload. The staff was really friendly and the snacks were yummy with a great selection of teas. Be ready to fall in love with the kitties! Can't wait to go back! Meow!
author: Yienie P.

description: The tea selection at Kit Tea is awesome and delicious! More importantly, the work that Kit Tea is doing to help cats find safe and loving homes is what really blew me away.  Playing with the sweet cats in the cat lounge is a relaxing and uplifting experience that am excited to do again. Also, I saw that there are special events, like movie nights, in the cat lounge  as well! I will definitely be coming back! What an awesome concept and relaxing environment!
author: Benjamin R.

description:
This place is amazing!!!! My first cat cafe experience was awesome!!! So many cute kitties and toys for them to play with... Staff was very helpful and friendly. Our spearmint tea was yummy. 

Even the bathroom was amazing! Haha 

If you want to get into the cat play room, definitely make sure to book a reservation in advance. Arrive a little early to check in and put in your tea and food orders.
author: Jen S.

description: Just having some cats around is enough for a 5 star experience. I've lived with cats all my life, so no wonder that I like any cat thing, but if you are not like me check other comments.
author: Babak G.

description: Wonder Cat Rescue brings cats and kittens into KitTea to find furever homes. In addition, you can come enjoy bottomless tea and help socialize with the adoptable kitties. Come visit and meet our purrfect match :D
author: Fanny T.

description: Charming calm atmosphere, comfortable cats, clean floors and cushions, not too many people in the 'lounge' at a time. And decent snacks.
author: M J.

description: $25 for 1 hour. Had a great time watching the cats play. Playing with the cats, and people watching. :) I am definitely a fan and am glad that they have one of these cafes in San Francisco. Oh and the tea is not bad at all.
author: Missy X.

description: Best $25 I've ever spent. The cats are so adorable and playful and the staff are friendly and clearly care a lot about the animals.
author: Adriana F.

description: I think the KitTea Cat Cafe was really cute and something different to do but I was hoping to see more rescue cats. The day I went, they only had one and he was in the back. I understand they don't want stress out a bunch of rescue cats BUT you need to state this clearly on your website. My expectations would of been different and I wouldn't of felt so cheated. Maybe I just went during an off day and they were in the process of transitioning cats in? I'm not sure but I was hoping to play with cats you could adopt and not the regular house cats. I was also thinking the cats would be more playful since they were only about 1 years old. That might of been my fault booking a time during lunch time, not sure. The staff was, for the most part nice. They do need to remember that not all people know a lot about cats so if we ask a question that sounds dumb... don't make us feel like we just asked a dumb question. Overall, I think the experience of was cute but I think I will stick to playing with my own cat. I would encourage people to visit because it was a cool little experience.
author: Kendell R.

description: So precious. And so worth it. I came from out of town and ended up being almost 30 mins late for my appt because I got lost. I had paid for an hour and was afraid they weren't going to let mt friends and I stay for a full hour. But the staff were so understanding and let us stay. The kittens were precious. And some were very playful. Everyone in the space was very good about sharing the kittens and taking turns with all of them. Some of the kittens even slept while you held them. It was beyond adorable. I totally recommend it here!
author: Gina M.

description: Great place!! A bit pricey but the staff and cats were so sweet. Food looked yummy and the free tea was nice as well! Parking was difficult but that was expected in such a busy part of the city. Go if you can/have time!!
author: Katie G.

description: Kittea Cafe is a unique concept for animal and tea lovers! The cafe has a tea lounge where you can sip on tea and small treats while watching cats play, and the other room is $15 for 30 minutes and $25 for an hour per person including tea for sipping in a room full of cats and kitties. When I went, the room had about 8-10 cats roaming around and playing, and we could use toys and sticks to play with the cats, which were all adorable and fun. The main point of this cafe is the cats, so the tea was slightly mediocre, and I have had better tea. Another thing that I was a little iffy about was the price. $25 per person per hour is a little expensive to pay for tea and playing with cats. Overall, the experience was unique and enjoyable, but I don't think I would come back, although I recommend it to others who have not visited to give it a try.
author: Annie C.

description: What a fun spot to visit! They have 3 small rooms: an entrance/gift shop where you check in, the cafe with tons of goodies, and the cat room. You sign up for an hour & get that time to sip on unlimited green tea while playing with cats & kittens! Make an appointment ahead of time as there are only a limited number of people allowed in at a time and they do get booked up! The cats are all available if you fall in love with one, but you can also just sit and enjoy. It was so hard to walk out without taking one with me!
author: Kari G.

description: I love cats and unlimited tea!! It was my 2nd time in here and I enjoyed playing with cats for $20 for a hour. The black cats are so outgoing and careful, their claws poke holes through my leggings :(
author: Julie M.

description:
This is basically paying to play with the kittens. Despite that it was pricey, the kittens are definitely adorable. The price ranges from $15-25 per person. It was $25 for an hour and $15 for half an hour, both prices include unlimited tea. 

I recommend making a reservation to the cat lounge in late afternoon as the kittens aren't very active in morning/early afternoon since they are more active at night. 

This is definitely a good idea to bring awareness for sheltered animals. They provide the options to adopt those kittens. Also, the necessary shots and procedures are included in the price.
author: Liz Y.

description: Fun place to visit-lots of cats doing their thing and being all cute and fluffeh. A hangout session with kittehz includes your choice of green tea.Food is decent as well, and you have the option of enjoying your noms in the cafe' area. They have some adorable cat themed merchandise as well in the reception area. Choose away for cute gifts of fellow cat people .
author: S D.

description:
amazing!! all the cats are adorable and it's set up to be an interactive play area with the cats. they did a great job decorating the cat's play space.. the cats can run along fun wooden shelf paths on the ceiling and tons of toys! 

it's $25/hour which includes unlimited tea. and they have a nice tea selection of about 8 teas. the whole interior is very cute and everything (including the cats) are very clean! I'm slightly allergic to cats but there's great circulation and humidifiers (even for the cats in their space). also when you leave they have lint rollers in the front and cute cat gifts. definitely worth going!! it was so much fun!
author: Jackie R.

description: Our visit was  only for an hour, but we enjoyed some time in the external cafe beforehand, That way, we were able to observe the furry residents prior to meeting them. There were seven cats out and about, although several slept the entire time. All of them seemed to be adolescents, about five to eirght months old. Most of them seemed to have no particular interest in visiting humans, but were ok with us trying interest them with toys. There  were also two white younger kittens in an enclosed play tent, who were off limits to us, but whose lively antics were fun to watch. This visit experience would be best for people who are new to interacting with cats. For those of us who are cat owners, it was a bit slow, but nice. FYI, the cafe has a diverse but petite menu that includes snacks, petite pastries, and lovely green teas. It is possible to order from the menu in the cafe and also in the cat visiting area.
author: Judith B C.

description: It is a great place to sit down to have quality tea and a tasty treat even if you're not planning to socialize with the cats. The spaces for both the tea lounge and cat social areas are very comfortable and well designed, however the chairs in the lounge aren't so comfortable. They have knobby tops on the front edges so people like me with fat thighs can feel it pressing into our legs. No bueno.
author: Elsie M.

description:
Expensive, but fun!

Half-hourly and hourly rates are quite steep, with higher rates during weekends. As mentioned in other reviews, reservations are recommended. The charge does include unlimited green and herbal teas. For me, a half-hour was enough.

One piece of advice--the kittens sleep a lot. We went at 3 pm, when all of them were snoozing. If you are expecting a more interactive experience, would recommend calling ahead and asking when the adorable bundles of fur are most active!
author: David T.

description: I love their yoga class. I always have a great time here and the cats are completely adorable.
author: Yvette R.

description: Love this place. We went for mew-vie night. Cat theme movie plus cats? Yes please!! We had so much fun with the kitties I couldn't even pay attention to the mew-vie.
author: Gigi T.

description: This is the happiest place on earth! Cats are so cute, well groomed and loved to be pet!
author: Ketan D.

description:
As much as I love cats, I was disappointed with the service here. We had made reservations and they told us to get a pot of tea while we waited. So we paid for a pot not knowing that the tea was complimentary with our reservation. In the end, they clarified that only the green teas were complimentary but honestly how hard is it to say that in the beginning. 

The cats were cute, but watch out some are feisty. The best time to go is at 11 or when they open.
author: K J.

description:
A great place to come and enjoy some cat time! At the moment they have 11 kittens so visit now, they are just adorable.

The tea set-up is somewhat secondary and the cafe and maybe needs a bit more thought - it is quite disjointed. 

A must for cat lovers.
author: Emma D.

description: I'm visiting San Francisco with my friend and when I heard about this I was so excited to check it out! We did the Wednesday night cats on mats yoga! It was awesome, my two favorite things combined. We had a few minutes after to play with the cats but I wish we had a little more. The yoga also included a cup of free tea! Can't go wrong with that! It is pricey, but you've gotta check it out! I enjoyed it and definitely recommend it.
author: Julie R.

description: Went to this place for the first time with two of my friends. We each got a waffle and went for an hour into the room with the cats. There were around 10 cats and 2 kittens - they were all very adorable. Most of the cats were playing or running around, a few were sleeping. The staff brought the waffles for us about halfway through the hour and also gave us limitless tea. Overall, I had a very enjoyable experience and would possibly consider coming back - the only thing stopping me would be the price ($25 for an hour with the cats and $11 for one waffle).
author: Eileen J.

description: Do you want to have tea, enjoy adoptable cats and kittens and be able to spend time relaxing along your feline companions, then you've come to the right place. KitTea offers a new experience in the Bay Area of being able to rent time to hang out with cats. It's fun, it's for a good cause and they sell waffles. Done and done.
author: Jackie H.

description: This place is adorable. It's very nicely put together; little gift shop, the cafe, and the cat room. I usually get the tea with the least amount of caffeine, and I can never remember what's it is called. The place is super clean and the staff are very friendly. It's fun to chat them up and learn about the different cats that live there. I really like the fact that they have activities that you can sign up for. At Christmas time they had a gingerbread house decorating night. Totally fun and they even supplied little plastic cats to put around my gingerbread yard. Movie nights, speed dating (although I'm too old for the age range), Saturday morning cartoons, etc. I'm going to book for their Mother's Day tea event and take my mom :). There website is really helpful with a lot of info to brush up on before going. If I ever come in to a bit of money, I'm booking a private event for my birthday! .
author: Kathlyn A.

description: This place is awesome! Purrfect for anyone interested in adopting a kitty or just playing with a kitty. I've been a few times and the staff is always so friendly and welcoming. KitTea has even started hosting special events so you can hangout to watch a movie and cuddle with a kitty too.
author: Lindsay M.

description: In the great debate between dogs vs. cats I vote dogs. However, this does not mean that I do not also think cats are great. My experience here with the cats was also great. They have happy hours where it's 50% off prices so instead of $14 for a 1/2 hour with the kitties it is $7. The price you pay with your reservation online includes unlimited free tea (mostly Japanese teas like Hojicha, etc.). I paid $14/person for a 1/2 hour with the kitties & thought the experience was superb! The space is super clean & tastefully decorated. You'll 1st walk into a lobby area where they have kitty art & an aroma diffuser with a nice subtle scent. You then enter the peaceful & sterile looking tea room where you pick out your tea & get pastries (not included in the price you paid online for the reservation). The tearoom has really great mid-century modern chairs & little tables. If you wish to just sit in the tea room & observe the kitties thru the glass you may. Their bathroom has a Japanese warming toilet with a bunch of fancy functions. It was my first time sitting on a warm toilet. You can bring the tea into the kitty room. Our tea wrangler was Maggie (Margie?) & she introduced us to the cats & gave us a run-down of the rules. If a cat is sleeping you are not to bother it but you may lightly pet it. I'd rather just not bother it because I personally wouldn't want to be touched if I were sleeping. Because they are all kittens, they are all still in training. Maggie reminded us not to let the cats make a habit of playing with our hands but instead the toys. She didn't want the cats to think that our hands were toys. About 1/3 of the kitties were sleeping while the rest were playing or walking around. The kitties are all adoptable. 26 kitties have been adopted since they opened. I think this is a great concept that was perfectly executed @ KitTea.
author: Brenda L.

description: It was fun seeing the cats, but there were too many people in the room for the number of cats they have. Would not recommend this, especially for how expensive it is. There were so many people in the room that half time I couldn't play with any cats and was just sitting around waiting. Plus they kept running out of tea. If you're looking to adopt a cat, go to an animal shelter.
author: Holly F.

description:
A few friends and I made a trip down here and I just had to come try this place out. I am obsessed with cats and was really looking forward to this. First off, the price is pretty expensive, but I felt it was worth it to at least try it out. The teas were really good. The cats themselves were mostly pretty shy and skittish, but that is to be expected since they are rescued cats and all. I was disappointed in the size of this place, however. The room is crowded and I didn't feel comfortable enough to play with the cats. There were way too many people in there all up in your space and it was annoying to have to deal with. So mostly, I just sat back and sipped on my tea. Either the place needs to be bigger, or they need to restrict the amount of people they allow back there with the cats. 

You are also allowed to adopt the cats, but the price is rather expensive. Why not just go to an animal shelter? Way cheaper and probably better cats. 

Overall, it was just an okay experience, but rather disappointing. Would I come back again? Probably not. Especially since the price is kind of expensive. For me, it was more of an "experience one time" kind of thing. I wouldn't feel like I was missing out on anything if I never went again.
author: Tisa L.

description: Pretty decent concept - you pay $25 to come in for an hour and drink Japanese tea and play with cats. The cats are available for adoption which is great so you know the cat is well acquainted with people (since they get petted about 8 hours every day); and you can interact with the cat before you take it home.
author: Wei W.

description: If you're a cat lady, there is no better place. I was in San Fran for a week for work, so I came here twice for an hour of cat lounge and once for cat yoga. It is so relaxing and clean and well maintained. This is the best unwinding I've ever experienced away from home. They are pretty tired out on weekend evenings, so if it works for you, try to go early on a weekday. Cat yoga was an incredible experience. The cats run around you and sit on your mat and rub up on you. The instructor was very soothing. If you're local, this is a great way to meet before adopting.
author: Tina T.

description:
I'm a bit in love.
Okay, maybe a lot in love.
A short background: I'm a die hard cat lady. I love cats. And I've always wanted to go to a cat cafe. I heard back in March that this place was going to open up during the summer, and I made a mental note that I had to go. Today I got to do just that!
Right when you enter, you can check in for your reservation (which they strongly recommend making in advance, as I believe the people cap for the cat lounge is 10). You can make a 30-minute reservation at $15 dollars per person, or an hour for $25 dollars per person.  The people at the front desk were amazingly kind and made me feel welcome. They led me to the tea lounge, where I could grab tea and any food I wanted to get before going in to see the cats. I chose "Cat Nap", one of their free complimentary teas (yum!). At 1:30, I was let in to meet the cats. Be aware that midday is usually kitty nap time, so they're going to be doing more sleeping than jumping around. One really cool thing was on a few of the tables in the cat cafe were cards explaining what certain tail signals mean signals mean, so guests don't accidentally scare a poor kitty. I believe we had 9 cats in the room with us. Warning, it's very hard not to fall in love with cats when they cuddle up to you during their naps. 
One thing I really like is that this cafe is part of an animal shelter, so it's a great way to make money for animals while allowing people to meet some of the cats they have!
Thank you Kittea, I cannot wait to return!
author: Riley E.

description: so... if cats is your thing... this is a must! 1 hour of pure bliss!
author: Ruby S.

description: KitTea definitely surpassed my expectations of a cat cafe. There is a large amount of kitties living in one place and they all seem like one big happy family more or less, it's clean, and all the KitTea staff I have interacted with are super friendly and helpful. The food items have all been pretty excellent too. My favorite chocolate chip cookie in San Francisco!
author: stephanie b.

description: What a fun experience. The kitties were adorable and the staff was knowledgeable and accommodating!
author: Kathryn D.

description: Loved this place! They are very well organized and have a lovely shop. The tea was actually very good, and the staff was friendly and thoughtful about not overwhelming the cats. All the cats are adoptable, so this provides socialization with people and other cats and some love and attention for them as well. It's a bit more expensive than the other cat cafes in the bay area, but from what I hear, it is worth it because of the ratio of people to cats that they allow. Overall, a really great experience. The only down side was that time FLEW by. Next time I will definitely book two hours in a row.
author: Ava S.

description: I love KitTea! It's like playing Neko Atsume in real life with actual cats. After looking at their page of available cats, I fell in love with one of them and went to meet him in early January. We hit it off right away and I adopted him the next day. The adoption process was quick and easy.
author: Mike C.

description: Not open yet but you have five stars from me for being super kind and not telling us to get out when we stopped in to check out your wonderful place.   I'm really looking forward to when you manage to get things open.   Good luck!
author: Melissa M.

description: This place was pretty cool. I've been considering opening one up in Chico so I was looking for some ideas. Two things I'd change; more space, less people. There were far too many people in one space and not enough room, so my guy and I could only really interact with a couple of the kittens. Also, they were all kittens. I think a separate room for older cats who like to snuggle would be ideal. It doesn't seem like it's a very large space to begin with so I totally understand their dilemma here. Anyway, overall we had a good time, good tea, and I got a cool t-shirt out of it so that was nice. It's definitely worth checking out. And come prepared to adopt!
author: Sarah D.

description: It was alright. The staff were really great but the cats were kind of aloof and boring. I know they're just cats and have no obligation to perform, but we went at 7pm and the cats mostly just wanted to sleep. There were only six cats  (3 tiny kittens and 3 slightly older cats) and I felt that there needed to be more, to be honest.
author: Phillip H.

description: Awesome concept! love the teas, the cats and the place itself is simple, clean, nice! everything looks pristine and the team is very young, professional and helpful. This is a great place to go and relax a little after work, after all cats are therapeutic and you get the chance to adopt them if you like, the kitties look so healthy. Just make sure you make your reservation online because the place it's packed with appointments.
author: Jenny C.

description: Only in SF could I drink a locally sourced organic tea while listening to a limited release EP of that band you like while watching cats frolic about on a giant hamster-esque cat wheel. What a world.
author: Alex C.

description: Very nice clean place with adorable cats to play with.  The tea was good and you can also order pastries and even a sandwich.
author: Baolin L.

description: I've come here twice and had great experiences both times. It's clear that the cats are very happy and comfortable here. The tea is great too. This place is awesome for giving cats a place to stay and helping them find a home. I wish there were more places like this.
author: Monica D.

description: Omg love this place. It's so cute and the this might be a bittersweet thing but there's a lot of cats/kittens for you to interact with. I booked my reservation online and the website is really helpful from booking your appointment to information on how to adopt one of the cats. It's totally user friendly. They keep it clean considering how many cats are there. They also have a separate area for you to eat for people who don't want to eat inside with the cats. You can tell they take really good care of the cats here. My boyfriend did make a comment on how he wish it was less people during the hour long session. I was whatever about it because we still spent a good amount of time with the cats. I was literally cradling a kitten cause he was so sleepy. KitTea also gives out stamp cards which pretty much encourages you to come back, which we will. Especially since they opened a Boba Guys nearby ;)
author: Jasmine Z.

description: Neat new concept with fun, interesting staff. Room was a little crowded because someone with a rez came at the wrong time. I would have appreciated it if the staff turned them down; otherwise, I had fun.
author: M H.

description: Gorgeous place and the kittens seem very happy and healthy there. The price is well worth what you get. It's $25 an hour, unlimited tea and time with lovely cats and kittens. When I went I think there was about 9 cats? They were mostly kittens with one mama cat (she wasn't the real mom of the kittens, but she took the role.) There were plenty of kittens around for everyone to get to play with them.
author: Julia H.

description: Cafe food and tea was great!  Love the decor! Chill kitties :)
author: Annabelle R.

description: Cute cats and unlimited tea. No regrets. Make sure to reserve for 1/2 off happy hours!
author: Carmen N.

description: I took my son here for a mom-son date. We are big fans of cats so we were thrilled with all the lovely, friendly kitties. We ordered tea we could bring in to the cat area. I kept asking for more hot water - the tea gets cold - but the waitperson was so kind and patient. We had the turkey panini and it was yummy. The only thing is the cat room has a particular smell to it - could it be the humidifier is pumping out a fragrance? It actually stank but I guess our noses got used to it. I will consider going back.
author: Em S.

description: The cats there are always fun, and the tea is great! Wish there were more places like this in America.
author: Michael F.

description: Love, love  this place! Like heaven for cat people! Awesome staff provides yummy Japanese tea and treats in addition to a space for spending time with cats and kittens and the lovely ladies who run the cafe and help find forever homes for these beautiful furry creatures who become our best friends and loving companions!!! Can't say enough about what a wonderful atmosphere they've created to nurture and love these sweet babies while they await their new families!
author: Debbie P.

description:
Fun concept till you hear what they charge you $24 hr or $12 half an hour 
with a cup of tea( herbal ) unlimited tea but really how much hot water do you need ?
some kitties were sleeping in the back so never got to see them , didn't want to wake them up they said 
the one we liked was already adopted 
overall nice place but needs improvement
author: Esther B.

description: Sooooo I came here earlier with a new friend of mine and we had quite the fun time. We are both avid cat lovers and both have a cat or cats.(I have two, she has one). I mentioned a place that had kittens after we expressed that we needed more cuddles with little balls of fur....That place was KITTEA I told her that it was all the "rage in Japan" supposedly and was a new place in this glorious city. She was shocked that as a Elite member of Yelp she didn't know about this furry heaven. It was as simple as going online and reserving our slot and for how many people. You get to choose from hourly to half hour and it even has an option to make an offer to reserve the whole place if people wanted. We booked our slot, jumped in Lyft and made or way inside. Immediately greeted by two women at the front counter and asked if it was a "walk in" or "reservation" I mentioned we had a slot and they immediately asked if I was Robert. Then told us to walk into the tea room and select tea from a 9 item list. We did so immediately and were handed two cups of steamy tea. We were flagged down to continue inside and did just that. Immediately we were overwhelmed. Kittens were everywhere. From a swinging suspended chair to a little cubby stack to cushions all over. A woman was inside who was a bit awkward but polite and told us that if we wanted more tea or snacks to let her know and she would take care of it. We immediately tarted petting the soft warm little bodies who were comfortably sleeping in the spaces of comfort. The hour flew by and I would definitely be coming back. The place is modern, clean, very friendly and relaxing. We both left with smiles on our face and relaxation emanating from our bodies. Good job KITTEA y'all are awesome.
author: Robert B.

description: Soooo...when can I start renting some space here to live? I am a crazy cat lady (yes, I even have a cattoo...sooo edgy) and on my honeymoon was really missing my baby back home. I mean, at that point I had gone almost a week without petting her! Luckily KitTea was there for me. My husband and I signed up for a 30 min slot each and let the cuteness begin! First of all, we were greeted by a really sweet girl who let us know the history behind the cafe. She was ridiculously nice and genuine, but then again, so was everyone! We then drank delicious citrus tea until it was our time to go hang out with the kitties. Yes, it was nap time when we went but I did not care. There's something so cozy about sipping on yummy tea while watching a cat sleep. I would definitely go back again next time I'm in SF- not quite an experience out there like that!
author: Catherine K.

description: CAT YOGA - I am absolutely obsessed with this place! I love everything about it and have only had incredible experiences. I love doing cat yoga there (especially with Lucia Young) because it's a totally relaxing, rejuvenating experience complete with CATS and TEA and GOOD VIBES. Seriously can't say enough about this place - it's an absolute must-see for out-of-towners too. Courtney, the owner, is always available to answer ?s and keeps things personal so it feels like a little community.
author: Beth W.

description: I visited KitTea for the first time yesterday and I loved it!  I reserved a half-hour time slot for $11 (a whole hour is $25), which seems a little expensive but it was totally worth it for me.  They had mostly kittens, a couple of older cats too.  They were all so cute and friendly!  I spent most of my half-hour with an adorable little tabby kitten resting on my lap :)  KitTea provides cat toys too, so you can get the kittens to play!  My friend had 4 kittens going crazy for a feather toy all at once, it was really cute and fun to watch.  I already can't wait to go back and play with some kittens! I was a little disappointed with the cafe's food.  Before our kitty playtime, I got some iced tea and a quiche, and my friend got the cheese and tomato panini.  The iced tea was really good, but I didn't like the food very much.  We also planned to share a pot of hot tea and get scone service when we were done playing with the kitties, but they had run out of scones by then, so we decided to just leave.  That was a bit of a bummer!  But I'll definitely go to KitTea again (and again!), so I'm sure I'll get to try the scones eventually :)
author: Lauren S.

description: Great place! It's very clean and the cats seem happy and well cared for. Great way to relax for an hour. The matcha cheesecake is amazing!
author: Jessica P.

description: KitTea is a wonderful experience with lovable cats and staff! The staff are extremely helpful and kind to not only you but the cats. Their customer service is beyond belief and their cats are adorable. The tea and food is delicious so make sure you try out everything there!
author: Roy K.
